studies.notes: The study showed improvement in metabolic parameters in PCOS patients, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

studies.title: The ameliorative effect of myo-inositol on apoptosis-related genes expression in cumulus cells of women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing ICSI and its relationship with the quality of oocyte and embryo.
studies.notes: The study shows that myo-inositol improves the expression of apoptosis-related genes in women with PCOS, indicating a beneficial effect on health outcomes related to fertility.

studies.title: Improvement in biochemical manifestations of the serum and follicular fluid and ICSI outcomes in PCOS patients with myo-inositol administration: prospective randomized research.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in hormonal profiles and oocyte/embryo quality in women with PCOS, indicating a beneficial effect of myo-inositol.

studies.title: The effect of Myo-inositol on fertility rates in poor ovarian responder in women undergoing assisted reproductive technique: a randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The intervention group showed improvements in several ART outcomes, but these were not statistically significant compared to the control group, leading to a classification of mixed outcomes.

studies.title: Effect of myo-inositol supplementation on ICSI outcomes among poor ovarian responder patients: A randomized controlled trial.

doses.duration: one month before starting ICSI cycle until ovulation trigger

studies.notes: The study found significant improvements in fertilization rate and embryo quality, indicating a benefit from myo-inositol supplementation.

indications.summary: The evidence for myo-inositol in improving fertility outcomes, particularly in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), is generally positive, with four studies reporting benefits and one showing mixed results. Typical doses reported include 2 g to 4 g daily, often combined with folic acid. However, the mixed findings in one study suggest that further research is needed to clarify its efficacy across different populations and treatment contexts.

studies.title: Effectiveness of dual combination therapy of acarbose plus metformin and acarbose plus myo-inositol in ameliorating the metabolic and endocrinologic complications of polycystic ovary syndrome - A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in metabolic and endocrinologic parameters in PCOS women, indicating a benefit from the combination therapies tested.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial demonstrated that myo-inositol, in combination with acarbose and metformin, significantly improved metabolic and endocrinologic parameters in women with polycystic ovary syndrome, suggesting a potential benefit for insulin resistance. The doses used in the study included 1000 mg of myo-inositol taken twice daily for six months. No adverse effects were reported, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Efficacy of myo-inositol and d-chiro-inositol combination on menstrual cycle regulation and improving insulin resistance in young women with polycystic ovary syndrome: A randomized open-label study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in menstrual cycle regulation and insulin resistance, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

studies.title: The 40:1 myo-inositol/D-chiro-inositol plasma ratio is able to restore ovulation in PCOS patients: comparison with other ratios.
studies.notes: The study found that the 40:1 MI/DCI ratio effectively restored ovulation in PCOS patients, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Comparative efficacy of combined myo-inositol and D-chiro inositol versus metformin across PCOS Phenotypes: enhancing ovarian function, ovulation, and stress response in a prospective clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in various health parameters for PCOS, indicating a benefit from the treatments.

indications.summary: The evidence from three randomized trials indicates that inositol, particularly in the form of a myo-inositol and D-chiro-inositol combination, may improve menstrual cycle regulation and ovulation in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Doses reported include 550 mg twice daily, 150 mg twice daily, and 2 g twice daily, with beneficial outcomes consistently observed across studies. No adverse effects were noted in the reviewed studies, but further research may be needed to confirm long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Effects of Myo-inositol Hexaphosphate (SNF472) on Bone Mineral Density in Patients Receiving Hemodialysis: An Analysis of the Randomized, Placebo-Controlled CaLIPSO Study.
studies.notes: Bone mineral density decreased in all groups, with no clear benefit from SNF472, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding inositol for low bone density is limited and mixed, primarily derived from one randomized trial (PMID 33835939) that reported no clear benefit on bone mineral density despite administering doses of 300 mg and 600 mg of Myo-inositol Hexaphosphate via intravenous infusion three times weekly for 52 weeks. Overall, the findings do not support a definitive effect of inositol on improving bone density in the studied population.

studies.title: High dose of d-chiro-inositol improves oocyte quality in women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing ICSI: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study found that high doses of DCI positively influenced oocyte quality, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial found that high doses of d-chiro-inositol (300 mg and 27.6 mg daily) improved oocyte quality in women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing ICSI. There is currently no evidence of harm or no benefit associated with inositol for this indication, but the overall evidence is limited to a single study, necessitating caution in interpretation.

studies.title: The impact of myo-inositol supplementation on sleep quality in pregnant women: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study found significant improvements in sleep quality metrics, indicating a beneficial effect of myo-inositol supplementation.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that myo-inositol supplementation may improve sleep quality, as indicated by one randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study involving pregnant women who received 2000 mg daily for 10 weeks. No adverse effects were reported in this study, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the effects in broader populations.

studies.title: Effect of intravenous iron therapy on exercise performance, fatigue scores and mood states in iron-deficient recreationally active females of reproductive age: a double-blind, randomised control trial (IRONWOMAN Trial).

indications.summary: The evidence on iron supplementation for low exercise performance is mixed. One randomized controlled trial found that intravenous iron therapy improved exercise economy and fatigue scores in iron-deficient females, while another study indicated that oral iron supplementation did not influence exercise performance despite aiding hematological recovery. Overall, the findings suggest potential benefits in specific populations but lack consistency across studies.

studies.title: A cleanser formulated with Tris (hydroxymethyl) aminomethane and l-arginine significantly improves facial acne in male Thai subjects.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in inflammatory acne and pore size with the Tris/Arg cleanser, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that a cleanser containing L-arginine may significantly improve inflammatory acne and pore size in male Thai subjects when used twice daily for four weeks. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: L-Arginine is a feasible supplement to heal chronic anal fissure via reducing internal anal sphincter pressure: a randomized clinical trial study.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in symptoms and quality of life in the L-arginine group compared to placebo.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported that L-Arginine (3000 mg three times a day for one month) may improve symptoms and quality of life in patients with chronic anal fissures by reducing internal anal sphincter pressure. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Effect of l-arginine compared to placebo on sexual function in women with major depressive disorder: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: While L-arginine showed some improvement in sexual function and mood, the changes were not statistically significant compared to the placebo group, leading to a classification of mixed_unclear.

indications.summary: The evidence for L-Arginine in treating depression is low quality, with a single randomized controlled trial reporting mixed results. In this study, L-Arginine (1 gram twice daily for four weeks) showed some improvement in sexual function and mood, but these changes were not statistically significant compared to placebo. No studies reported clear benefits or harms associated with L-Arginine for this indication.

studies.title: Beneficial effects of L-Arginine in patients hospitalized for COVID-19: New insights from a randomized clinical trial.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial suggests that L-Arginine may have beneficial effects in patients hospitalized for COVID-19, specifically reducing the need for respiratory support and shortening hospital stays. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess safety and efficacy across diverse populations.

studies.title: Daily Oral l-Arginine Plus Tadalafil in Diabetic Patients with Erectile Dysfunction: A Double-Blinded, Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial.

studies.title: Adjuvant daily therapy with L-arginine 2,500 mg and tadalafil 5 mg increases efficacy and duration of benefits of low-intensity extracorporeal shock wave therapy for erectile dysfunction: A prospective, randomized, single-blinded study with 1-year follow-up.

studies.title: Comparison of the clinical efficacy of daily use of L-arginine, tadalafil and combined L-arginine with tadalafil in the treatment of elderly patients with erectile dysfunction.

studies.title: Efficacy and tolerability of sildenafil/l-arginine combination relative to sildenafil alone in patients with organic erectile dysfunction.

studies.title: Long-term high-dose L-arginine supplementation in patients with vasculogenic erectile dysfunction: a multicentre, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in erectile function, indicating a beneficial effect of L-Arginine supplementation.

indications.summary: The clinical evidence for L-Arginine in the treatment of erectile dysfunction is positive, with five randomized controlled trials reporting significant improvements in erectile function across various doses, typically ranging from 2,500 mg to 6 g daily. No studies reported harm or lack of benefit, suggesting a consistent beneficial effect; however, the long-term safety and efficacy of high-dose supplementation remain to be fully established.

studies.title: Wheat Protein Hydrolysate Fortified With l-Arginine Enhances Satiation Induced by the Capsaicinoid Nonivamide in Moderately Overweight Male Subjects.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in calorie intake and enhanced satiation, indicating a beneficial effect of L-Arginine.

indications.summary: One randomized trial suggests that L-Arginine may enhance satiation and reduce calorie intake in moderately overweight male subjects at a dose of 3.2 g. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study reporting a benefit and no evidence of harm or no benefit. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Effect of l-arginine on cardiac reverse remodeling and quality of life in patients with heart failure.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in cardiac function and quality of life, indicating a beneficial effect of L-Arginine supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that L-Arginine supplementation (3 grams daily for 10 weeks) resulted in significant improvements in cardiac function and quality of life in patients with heart failure. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating a benefit and no reports of harm or mixed outcomes. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: L-arginine supplementation to mitigate cardiovascular effects of walking outside in the context of traffic-related air pollution in participants with elevated blood pressure: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.

studies.title: A Single Dosage of l-Arginine Oral Supplementation Induced Post-Aerobic Exercise Hypotension in Hypertensive Patients.
studies.notes: The study showed significant post-exercise hypotension in hypertensive patients after l-arginine supplementation, indicating a beneficial effect on blood pressure management.

indications.summary: L-arginine supplementation appears to have a beneficial effect on blood pressure, as evidenced by two randomized trials showing significant reductions in blood pressure levels. Doses reported include 8 grams as a single dose and 9 grams daily for two weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited to a small number of studies, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Postprandial Glucose and Gastrointestinal Hormone Responses of Healthy Subjects to Wheat Biscuits Enriched with L-Arginine or Branched-Chain Amino Acids of Plant Origin.
studies.notes: The study shows that L-Arginine supplementation in wheat biscuits leads to lower postprandial glucose levels and improved satiety, indicating a beneficial effect on metabolic responses.

indications.summary: One study suggests that L-Arginine supplementation, when incorporated into wheat biscuits, may lower postprandial glucose levels and improve satiety in healthy subjects. However, the evidence is limited, with only one trial reporting a benefit and no studies indicating harm or mixed outcomes. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistent dosing.

studies.title: Effect of L-arginine on energy metabolism, skeletal muscle and brown adipose tissue in South Asian and Europid prediabetic men: a randomised double-blinded crossover study.
studies.notes: L-Arginine improved glucose tolerance in Europids but not in South Asians, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for L-Arginine in managing high blood sugar in Type 2 Diabetes is low and mixed. A randomized double-blinded crossover study reported improved glucose tolerance in Europid participants but not in South Asians, suggesting variability in response. No consistent beneficial effects were observed across studies, and no adverse effects were reported.

studies.title: High intensity interval training and L-Arginine supplementation decrease interleukin-6 levels in adult trained males.

Further research is needed to establish the efficacy and safety of L-Arginine for this indication.

However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the long-term effects and safety of L-Arginine in this population.

studies.title: Investigation of the effect of nitrate and L-arginine intake on aerobic, anaerobic performance, balance, agility, and recovery in elite taekwondo athletes.

studies.title: Effects of Chronic Supplementation of L-Arginine on Physical Fitness in Water Polo Players.
studies.notes: L-Arginine improved oxidative metabolism as indicated by a lower lactate-to-speed ratio, suggesting a benefit in exercise performance.

studies.title: A combination of oral L-citrulline and L-arginine improved 10-min full-power cycling test performance in male collegiate soccer players: a randomized crossover trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant improvement in cycling performance and subjective perception of exertion, indicating a benefit from L-Arginine supplementation.

studies.title: Effects of Co-Ingestion of β-Hydroxy-β-Methylbutyrate and L-Arginine α-Ketoglutarate on Jump Performance in Young Track and Field Athletes.

indications.summary: The evidence from five randomized trials indicates that L-Arginine supplementation may improve exercise performance across various metrics, including endurance and power output. Commonly reported doses range from 1.2 g to 10 g daily, with benefits observed in different athletic populations. No studies reported harm or lack of benefit, but the overall quality and consistency of the evidence warrant cautious interpretation.

studies.notes: The study suggests potential benefits in cognitive performance and stress reduction, but also notes limited negative findings and a small sample size, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: Probiotics and magnesium orotate for the treatment of major depressive disorder: a randomised double blind controlled trial.

studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in depressive symptoms with magnesium supplementation, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Effects of Coenzyme Q10, Tryptophan, and Magnesium Supplementation on Fatigue in Patients with Fibromyalgia - A Randomized Trial.
studies.notes: Fatigue improved significantly in the placebo group, while the dietary supplement group showed a non-significant reduction in fatigue, indicating mixed outcomes.

One randomized trial reported a non-significant reduction in fatigue among participants receiving magnesium compared to a significant improvement in the placebo group, indicating unclear efficacy. No consistent dose ranges were reported, and no adverse effects were noted in the studies reviewed.

studies.title: Effects of Coenzyme Q10, Tryptophan, and Magnesium Supplementation on Fatigue in Patients with Fibromyalgia - A Randomized Trial.
studies.notes: Fatigue improved significantly in the placebo group, while the dietary supplement group showed a non-significant reduction in fatigue, indicating mixed outcomes.

One randomized trial reported a non-significant reduction in fatigue among those receiving magnesium compared to a significant improvement in the placebo group, indicating unclear benefits. studies.title: Effects of deep ocean-derived magnesium-enhanced water on metabolic diseases with microbiome changes.
studies.notes: The study shows improvements in various metabolic parameters, indicating a beneficial effect of magnesium intake.

studies.notes: The outcomes indicated a decrease in exercise performance metrics, suggesting harm from magnesium supplementation in this context.

studies.title: Melatonin Supplementation Alleviates Bone Mineral Density Decline and Circulating Oxidative Stress in Iron-Overloaded Thalassemia Patients.

studies.notes: The study shows that NR supplementation benefits aged individuals by improving the NAD+ metabolome and reducing inflammatory cytokines.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that nicotinamide riboside (1 g orally per day for 21 days) may reduce inflammatory cytokines and improve the NAD+ metabolome in aged individuals, suggesting a potential anti-inflammatory effect. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Nicotinamide riboside and pterostilbene reduces markers of hepatic inflammation in NAFLD: A double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant decrease in liver enzymes and toxic lipid levels, indicating a benefit in reducing hepatic inflammation in NAFLD.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial suggests that Nicotinamide Riboside, in combination with Pterostilbene, may reduce markers of hepatic inflammation in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) when administered at a daily dose for six months. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Oral nicotinamide riboside raises NAD+ and lowers biomarkers of neurodegenerative pathology in plasma extracellular vesicles enriched for neuronal origin.
studies.notes: The study shows that oral nicotinamide riboside supplementation benefits neurodegenerative pathology by increasing NAD+ levels and decreasing specific biomarkers.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that oral nicotinamide riboside (500 mg twice daily for 6 weeks) may benefit neurodegenerative pathology by increasing NAD+ levels and reducing specific biomarkers in plasma extracellular vesicles. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study showing a benefit and no reports of harm or no benefit. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: The NADPARK study: A randomized phase I trial of nicotinamide riboside supplementation in Parkinson's disease.
studies.notes: The study showed mild clinical improvement in patients with Parkinson's disease, indicating a benefit from nicotinamide riboside supplementation.

indications.summary: The evidence for nicotinamide riboside in Parkinson's disease is limited to one randomized phase I trial, which reported mild clinical improvement with a daily dose of 1000 mg over 30 days. No studies have shown harm or no benefit, but the overall evidence is still considered low-quality and requires further investigation to confirm these findings.

studies.title: NR-SAFE: a randomized, double-blind safety trial of high dose nicotinamide riboside in Parkinson's disease.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated clinical improvement in Parkinson's disease symptoms with no severe adverse events, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported a beneficial outcome of nicotinamide riboside at a dose of 1500 mg twice daily for four weeks in improving Parkinson's disease symptoms, with no severe adverse events noted. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Nicotinamide riboside for peripheral artery disease: the NICE randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant improvement in walking distance for patients with PAD, indicating a beneficial effect of nicotinamide riboside.

indications.summary: Nicotinamide riboside has shown a beneficial effect on walking distance in patients with peripheral artery disease, as evidenced by a single randomized clinical trial. However, the overall evidence is limited to this one study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Nicotinamide Riboside Supplementation Benefits in Patients With Werner Syndrome: A Double-Blind Randomized Crossover Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in various health outcomes related to Werner Syndrome, indicating a beneficial effect of Nicotinamide Riboside supplementation.

indications.summary: Nicotinamide Riboside supplementation has shown a beneficial effect in a double-blind randomized crossover placebo-controlled trial involving patients with Werner Syndrome, with a dose of 1000 mg once daily for 26 weeks. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Anti-acne properties of hydrophobic fraction of red ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer) and its active components.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated that red ginseng extract effectively improved acne symptoms, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: There is low-quality evidence suggesting that a hydrophobic fraction of red ginseng (Panax ginseng) may improve acne symptoms, based on a single study that reported a benefit with a topical application at a dose of 3 mg/g for four weeks. No adverse effects were noted, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistency across studies.

studies.title: Panax ginseng may improve some symptoms of attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder.
studies.notes: The study indicates a slight improvement in ADHD symptoms, suggesting a benefit from Panax ginseng.

indications.summary: Current evidence on Panax ginseng for ADHD symptoms is limited, with only one study suggesting a slight improvement in symptoms. The overall quality of evidence is low, and no consistent dose ranges or adverse effects have been reported. Further research is needed to establish efficacy and safety.

studies.title: Antioxidant effects of Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer in healthy subjects: a randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant decreases in serum ROS and MDA levels, indicating a beneficial antioxidant effect of Panax ginseng.

indications.summary: One randomized, placebo-controlled trial demonstrated that Panax ginseng (1 g daily for 4 weeks) significantly reduced serum reactive oxygen species (ROS) and malondialdehyde (MDA) levels, suggesting a beneficial antioxidant effect. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Effects of Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Mayer) and its isolated ginsenosides and polysaccharides on arterial stiffness in healthy individuals.
studies.notes: The study shows that KRG significantly lowered arterial stiffness, indicating a potential benefit for cardiovascular health.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in reducing arterial stiffness is limited, with only one study reporting a benefit from a single dose of 3 g of Korean red ginseng. No adverse effects were noted, but the overall quality and quantity of evidence are low, necessitating caution in interpretation.

studies.title: Electrocardiographic and hemodynamic effects of Panax ginseng.
studies.notes: The study found an increase in QTc interval and a decrease in diastolic blood pressure, but the effects were not considered clinically significant.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding Panax ginseng for blood pressure is limited and mixed. One study reported a decrease in diastolic blood pressure and an increase in QTc interval with a daily dose of 200 mg of extract for 28 days, but these effects were not deemed clinically significant. Overall, there is no consistent evidence supporting a beneficial effect on blood pressure.

studies.title: A Combination of Essential Fatty Acids, Panax Ginseng Extract, and Green Tea Catechins Modifies Brain fMRI Signals in Healthy Older Adults.
studies.notes: The study suggests cognitive improvements and brain activation changes, but lacks significant differences compared to placebo, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in enhancing brain functioning is low, with only one study reporting mixed outcomes. This study indicated potential cognitive improvements and changes in brain activation, but did not show significant differences compared to placebo. No consistent dose ranges were reported, and no adverse effects were noted in the available evidence.

studies.title: Panax ginseng C.A Meyer root extract for moderate chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): study protocol for a randomised controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study aims to assess quality of life improvements and other outcomes, but results are not yet available.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in improving breathing difficulties due to COPD is currently low. One randomized controlled trial is underway, which aims to evaluate quality of life and other outcomes with a dose of 100 mg twice daily for 24 weeks, but results are not yet available. No studies have reported a clear benefit or harm associated with this supplement for this indication.

studies.title: Panax ginseng (G115) improves aspects of working memory performance and subjective ratings of calmness in healthy young adults.
studies.notes: The study found dose-related benefits in mood and cognitive performance, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that Panax ginseng (G115) at doses of 200 mg and 400 mg daily for 7 days improved aspects of working memory and subjective ratings of calmness in healthy young adults. Overall, the evidence suggests a potential benefit for calmness, but further studies are needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Antifatigue effects of Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer: a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: While there were improvements in mental NRS and VAS scores with 2 g of Panax ginseng, the overall total NRS score did not show statistically significant improvement compared to placebo.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in treating chronic fatigue is low quality, with only one randomized trial reporting mixed results. In this study, a 2 g daily dose showed some improvements in mental fatigue scores, but the overall fatigue score did not reach statistical significance compared to placebo. No adverse effects were noted, but the lack of consistent benefit limits the strength of the findings.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng extract in patients with fibromyalgia: a 12-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed benefits in pain reduction and quality of life, but no significant differences between groups, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in the treatment of chronic pain is low quality, with only one randomized trial reporting mixed outcomes. In this study, a daily dose of 100 mg of ginseng extract for 12 weeks showed some benefits in pain reduction and quality of life, but no significant differences were observed between the treatment and placebo groups. Overall, the findings do not support a clear benefit for chronic pain management.

studies.title: Acute, dose-dependent cognitive effects of Ginkgo biloba, Panax ginseng and their combination in healthy young volunteers: differential interactions with cognitive demand.
studies.notes: The study shows a dose-dependent improvement in cognitive performance, indicating a benefit from Panax ginseng.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates a dose-dependent improvement in cognitive performance with Panax ginseng in healthy adults, with doses of 640 mg and 960 mg showing benefits. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Panax ginseng enhances cognitive performance in Alzheimer disease.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive performance after treatment with Panax ginseng, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Electroencephalograph effects of single doses of Ginkgo biloba and Panax ginseng in healthy young volunteers.
studies.notes: The study shows that Panax ginseng significantly modulates cerebroelectrical activity, indicating a benefit in cognitive performance.

studies.title: Improved cognitive performance in human volunteers following administration of guarana (Paullinia cupana) extract: comparison and interaction with Panax ginseng.
studies.notes: The study shows improved cognitive performance with Panax ginseng, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: Human clinical evidence suggests that Panax ginseng may enhance cognitive performance in individuals with cognitive impairment, with three studies reporting benefits. Doses reported include 4.5 g daily for 12 weeks and single doses of 200 mg. No adverse effects or harms were noted in the studies; however, the overall quality and consistency of the evidence warrant cautious interpretation.

studies.title: Effects of tissue-cultured mountain ginseng (Panax ginseng CA Meyer) extract on male patients with erectile dysfunction.
studies.notes: The TMGE group showed significant improvement in erectile function compared to the placebo group, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that Panax ginseng (1000 mg extract twice a day for 8 weeks) significantly improved erectile function compared to placebo, indicating a potential benefit for erectile dysfunction. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Vascular effects of combined enriched Korean Red ginseng (Panax Ginseng) and American ginseng (Panax Quinquefolius) administration in individuals with hypertension and type 2 diabetes: A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed a reduction in central systolic blood pressure, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

studies.title: Effect of Rg3-enriched Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng) on arterial stiffness and blood pressure in healthy individuals: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study found significant reductions in various blood pressure parameters, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: Current evidence from two randomized controlled trials suggests that Panax ginseng may have a beneficial effect on blood pressure, with one study reporting a reduction in central systolic blood pressure at a dose of 2.25 g three times daily over 12 weeks, and another showing significant reductions in blood pressure parameters with a single dose of 400 mg. However, the overall evidence is limited and further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistent dosing guidelines.

studies.title: Null and opposing effects of Asian ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer) on acute glycemia: results of two acute dose escalation studies.
studies.notes: The study found both null and opposing effects on glycemia, indicating variability in ginseng's effects.

studies.title: Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer) root fractions: differential effects on postprandial glycemia in healthy individuals.
studies.notes: The KRG-body significantly lowered postprandial glucose levels, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng, consumed with and without glucose, on blood glucose levels and cognitive performance during sustained 'mentally demanding' tasks.
studies.notes: The study shows that Panax ginseng enhances cognitive performance and reduces blood glucose levels, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Single doses of Panax ginseng (G115) reduce blood glucose levels and improve cognitive performance during sustained mental activity.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive performance and reductions in blood glucose levels, indicating a beneficial effect of Panax ginseng.

studies.title: The glycaemic effects of single doses of Panax ginseng in young healthy volunteers.
studies.notes: The study shows that Panax ginseng significantly lowers fasting blood glucose levels, indicating a beneficial effect on glycaemic control.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in lowering high blood sugar is mixed but leans towards benefit, with four studies reporting positive effects on glycemic control, particularly with doses of 200 mg to 3 g. However, one study showed variable effects, indicating that responses may differ among individuals. No adverse effects were reported in the reviewed studies.

studies.title: Effects of ginseng berry saponins from panax ginseng on glucose metabolism of patients with prediabetes: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled, crossover trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant benefits in glucose metabolism and insulin resistance in prediabetic patients using Panax ginseng saponins.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled trial reported that Panax ginseng saponins improved glucose metabolism and insulin resistance in patients with prediabetes over a 4-week period. No studies reported mixed results or adverse effects, but the overall evidence remains limited and should be interpreted with caution due to the small number of trials available.

studies.title: Ethanol extraction preparation of American ginseng (Panax quinquefolius L) and Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer): differential effects on postprandial insulinemia in healthy individuals.
studies.notes: The study found increased insulin sensitivity with specific ginseng extracts, indicating a beneficial effect on insulin parameters.

studies.title: Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng) improves glucose and insulin regulation in well-controlled, type 2 diabetes: results of a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of efficacy and safety.
studies.notes: While HbA1c did not change, other glucose and insulin regulation measures improved, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding Panax ginseng for high blood sugar in Type 2 Diabetes is mixed. One study reported a benefit in insulin sensitivity with a single dose of 3 g, while two other studies showed unclear results regarding glucose regulation, with doses of 6 g daily for 12 weeks and no reported adverse effects. Overall, the findings do not consistently support a clear benefit for glucose control.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng extract on lipid metabolism in humans.
studies.notes: The study reports a decrease in total cholesterol, triglycerides, and LDL, and an increase in HDL, indicating a beneficial effect on lipid metabolism.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that Panax ginseng may have a beneficial effect on lipid metabolism, specifically in reducing total cholesterol, triglycerides, and LDL, while increasing HDL, based on a single study using a dose of 6 g per day for 8 weeks. However, due to the low number of studies and the absence of corroborating evidence, the overall confidence in this effect is low.

studies.title: Short-Term Panax Ginseng Extract Supplementation Reduces Fasting Blood Triacylglycerides and Oxygen Consumption during Sub-Maximal Aerobic Exercise in Male Recreational Athletes.
studies.notes: The study showed benefits in blood lipid profile and energy consumption during exercise, indicating a positive effect of Panax ginseng supplementation.

studies.title: Panax ginseng Supplementation Increases Muscle Recruitment, Attenuates Perceived Effort, and Accelerates Muscle Force Recovery After an Eccentric-Based Exercise in Athletes.
studies.notes: The study shows that Panax ginseng improves muscle recruitment and recovery, indicating a beneficial effect on muscle performance in athletes.

studies.title: Effects of acute supplementation of caffeine and Panax ginseng on endurance running performance in a hot and humid environment.
studies.notes: The study found a significant improvement in endurance performance with the supplementation of Panax ginseng combined with caffeine.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng extract on exercise-induced oxidative stress.
studies.notes: The study shows that Panax ginseng extract improves exercise duration and reduces oxidative stress markers, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: The evidence from four studies suggests that Panax ginseng may improve low exercise performance by enhancing muscle recruitment, reducing perceived effort, and improving endurance. Reported doses include 500 mg daily for 14 days, 200 mg as a single acute dose, and 2 g three times daily for 8 weeks. However, the overall quality of the evidence is mixed, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Pharmacokinetic Study of Compound K in Japanese Subjects After Ingestion of Panax ginseng Fermented by Lactobacillus paracasei A221 Reveals Significant Increase of Absorption into Blood.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant increase in testosterone levels and absorption of Compound K, indicating a beneficial effect of fermented Panax ginseng.

indications.summary: Current evidence on Panax ginseng for low testosterone levels is limited, with only one study reporting a significant increase in testosterone levels following ingestion of fermented Panax ginseng. No adverse effects were noted, but the overall quality of evidence is low due to the limited number of studies available.

studies.title: Differential, dose dependent changes in cognitive performance following acute administration of a Ginkgo biloba/Panax ginseng combination to healthy young volunteers.
studies.notes: The study showed a dose-dependent improvement in memory quality at the highest dose, but also a decrement in attention speed at lower doses, indicating mixed outcomes.

studies.title: The memory enhancing effects of a Ginkgo biloba/Panax ginseng combination in healthy middle-aged volunteers.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant improvement in memory quality, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

studies.title: Efficacy and Safety of Panax ginseng Sprout Extract in Subjective Memory Impairment: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in memory-related assessments, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in improving memory problems is mixed. Two studies reported benefits, with one using a dose of 450 mg daily for 12 weeks and another using 100 mg twice daily for 14 weeks. However, a third study indicated mixed outcomes, showing dose-dependent effects that included both improvements and decrements in cognitive performance, suggesting variability in response. No adverse effects were reported in the studies reviewed.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng supplementation on muscle damage and inflammation after uphill treadmill running in humans.
studies.notes: The study found significant reductions in muscle damage and inflammatory markers, indicating a beneficial effect of Panax ginseng supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that Panax ginseng supplementation (20 g of Korean red ginseng extract three times daily for 11 days) significantly reduced muscle damage and inflammatory markers after exercise, indicating a potential benefit for muscle soreness. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Modulation of endothelial function by Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer) and its components in healthy individuals: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study found that KRG significantly improved endothelial function, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial found that a single dose of 3 g of Korean red ginseng (Panax ginseng) significantly improved endothelial function in healthy individuals. Overall, the evidence is limited to this single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effects of Panax ginseng on quality of life.
studies.notes: The study shows a benefit in mental health and social functioning after 4 weeks, although effects did not persist at 8 weeks.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that Panax ginseng may have a beneficial effect on mental health, specifically in improving quality of life and social functioning, as indicated by one study using a dose of 200 mg daily for 8 weeks. However, the effects were not sustained beyond 4 weeks, indicating uncertainty about long-term benefits. No adverse effects were reported in the studies reviewed.

studies.title: Effects of Korean Red Ginseng (Panax ginseng C.A. Meyer) on Menopausal Symptoms in Premenopausal Women After Gynecologic Cancer Surgery: A Double-Blind, Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed no significant difference in overall menopausal symptom relief between KRG and placebo, but indicated potential benefit in reducing sexual complaints.

indications.summary: The evidence for Panax ginseng in treating sexual dysfunction is limited and classified as low quality. One randomized controlled trial reported mixed results, indicating potential benefits in reducing sexual complaints but no significant overall improvement in menopausal symptoms. The typical dose reported was 3 g per day for 12 weeks, but further research is needed to clarify its efficacy and safety.

studies.title: Effect of Hydroponically Grown Red Panax Ginseng on Perceived Stress Level, Emotional Processing, and Cognitive Functions in Moderately Stressed Adults: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant benefits in reducing perceived stress and improving emotional and cognitive functions in the Ginseng group compared to placebo.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study found that 200 mg of hydroponically grown Red Panax Ginseng daily for three weeks significantly reduced perceived stress and improved emotional and cognitive functions in moderately stressed adults. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating benefit and no reports of harm or mixed outcomes.

studies.title: Panax ginseng (G115) improves aspects of working memory performance and subjective ratings of calmness in healthy young adults.
studies.notes: The study found dose-related benefits in mood and cognitive performance, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that Panax ginseng (G115) at doses of 200 mg and 400 mg daily for 7 days improved aspects of subjective mood and cognitive performance in healthy young adults. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: The Effect of Panax ginseng on Genitourinary Syndrome in Postmenopausal Women: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: Ginseng improved subjective symptoms but had no significant effect on objective clinician-assessed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding Panax ginseng for vaginal dryness is limited and mixed. One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial reported subjective symptom improvement but found no significant effect on objective clinician-assessed outcomes. Overall, the quality of evidence is low, and no consistent dosing information is available.

studies.title: Panax ginseng (G115) improves aspects of working memory performance and subjective ratings of calmness in healthy young adults.
studies.notes: The study found dose-related benefits in mood and cognitive performance, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that Panax ginseng (G115) may improve aspects of working memory performance and subjective calmness in healthy young adults, with reported doses of 200 mg and 400 mg daily for 7 days. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Efficacy and Safety of Enzyme-Modified Panax ginseng for Anti-Wrinkle Therapy in Healthy Skin: A Single-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study found significant benefits in reducing eye wrinkle formation without reported adverse reactions.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study reported significant benefits of enzyme-modified Panax ginseng cream in reducing eye wrinkle formation, with no adverse reactions noted. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings and establish consistency.

contraindications: Monitor patients taking CYP3A substrates with narrow therapeutic ranges closely.
abolished the increase in muscle mass
concomitant ingestion with prescription medications should be discouraged
mild adverse events such as dyspepsia, hot flash, insomnia, and constipation
possible drug interactions with warfarin, phenelzine, and alcohol

studies.title: Effect of peppermint oil and caraway oil on gastrointestinal motility in healthy volunteers: a pharmacodynamic study using simultaneous determination of gastric and gall-bladder emptying and orocaecal transit time.
studies.notes: The study shows mixed effects on gastrointestinal motility, with peppermint oil prolonging orocaecal transit time but not significantly affecting gastric emptying.

indications.summary: The evidence for peppermint oil in alleviating abdominal discomfort is limited and mixed, with one study indicating that it may prolong orocaecal transit time without significantly affecting gastric emptying. The typical dose reported in this study was 90 mg of oil. Overall, the findings do not support a clear benefit for this indication.

studies.title: A trial-based economic evaluation of peppermint oil for the treatment of irritable bowel syndrome.
studies.notes: The study shows that peppermint oil is a cost-effective treatment for IBS, indicating a benefit in terms of effectiveness and cost-effectiveness compared to placebo.

studies.title: Efficacy and Safety of Peppermint Oil in a Randomized, Double-Blind Trial of Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome.
studies.notes: The study found no significant benefit in primary endpoints but some improvements in secondary outcomes, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: Efficacy of Peppermint oil in diarrhea predominant IBS - a double blind randomized placebo - controlled study.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in abdominal pain with peppermint oil, indicating a benefit, although other symptoms and quality of life did not improve significantly.

studies.title: The effect of enteric-coated, delayed-release peppermint oil on irritable bowel syndrome.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in abdominal pain and quality of life, indicating a beneficial effect of peppermint oil.

indications.summary: The evidence for peppermint oil in treating abdominal pain, particularly in the context of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), is mixed but leans towards benefit. Three studies reported significant improvements in abdominal pain, while one study showed unclear results with no significant benefit in primary endpoints. Doses varied, with some studies using enteric-coated formulations at 182 mg daily or 1 capsule three times daily, but no adverse effects were reported in the reviewed studies.

studies.title: Peppermint oil (Mintoil) in the treatment of irritable bowel syndrome: a prospective double blind placebo-controlled randomized trial.
studies.notes: The study found a significant reduction in irritable bowel syndrome symptoms with peppermint oil compared to placebo.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial demonstrated that peppermint oil significantly reduced symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome compared to placebo, using a dose of 2 enteric-coated capsules twice daily for 4 weeks. There is currently no evidence of harm or no benefit reported, but further studies may be needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: Effects of inhalation of peppermint oil after lumbar discectomy surgery on pain and anxiety levels of patients: A randomized controlled study.
studies.notes: The study found statistically significant reductions in pain and anxiety levels after the intervention, indicating a benefit from peppermint oil inhalation.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported a benefit of peppermint oil inhalation (5 drops for 10 minutes) in reducing anxiety levels following lumbar discectomy surgery. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available, and no adverse effects were reported. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish broader applicability.

studies.title: Effects of peppermint oil and caraway oil on gastroduodenal motility.
studies.notes: The study shows that peppermint oil has beneficial effects on gastroduodenal motility, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: There is low-quality evidence suggesting that peppermint oil may have beneficial effects on gastroduodenal motility, as indicated by one study that reported positive outcomes with doses of 90 mg in both enteric-coated and non-enteric-coated forms. However, due to the limited number of studies and the absence of corroborating evidence, the overall confidence in these findings is low.

studies.title: Effects of intraduodenal application of peppermint oil (WS(R) 1340) and caraway oil (WS(R) 1520) on gastroduodenal motility in healthy volunteers.
studies.notes: The study shows significant effects of peppermint oil on gastroduodenal motility, indicating a benefit for the studied condition.

indications.summary: One randomized trial demonstrated a benefit of peppermint oil (90 mg, intraduodenal application) on gastroduodenal motility in healthy volunteers, suggesting potential efficacy for indigestion. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess safety and tolerability.

studies.title: A Novel Delivery System of Peppermint Oil Is an Effective Therapy for Irritable Bowel Syndrome Symptoms.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant reduction in IBS symptoms with peppermint oil compared to placebo, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial has shown that peppermint oil, administered as a sustained release formulation three times daily for four weeks, significantly reduces symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) compared to placebo. There is currently no evidence of harm or mixed outcomes associated with its use in this context. However, further studies may be needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: The Effects of Peppermint Oil on Nausea, Vomiting and Retching in Cancer Patients Undergoing Chemotherapy: An Open Label Quasi-Randomized Controlled Pilot Study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant reduction in nausea, vomiting, and retching in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy when peppermint oil was used, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence from a single pilot study indicating that peppermint oil may reduce nausea, vomiting, and retching in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy, with a dose of 1 drop (aromatic mixture) three times a day for five days. However, the evidence is based on a quasi-randomized design, which may limit the reliability of the findings. No adverse effects were reported in this study.

studies.title: Effect of acute peppermint oil administration on gastric sensorimotor function and nutrient tolerance in health.
studies.notes: The study shows reduced intragastric pressure and appetite after peppermint oil administration, but no significant effects on nutrient tolerance or gastric sensitivity, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

indications.summary: The evidence for peppermint oil in improving poor appetite is limited and mixed, with one study indicating reduced intragastric pressure and appetite following a single dose of 182 mg, but no significant effects on nutrient tolerance or gastric sensitivity. Overall, there is no consistent evidence supporting its efficacy for this indication.

studies.title: Examining the Effect of Peppermint Oil on Postoperative Nausea After Cervical Surgery.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant reduction in postoperative nausea and vomiting with peppermint oil, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that peppermint oil, administered through aromatherapy inhalation, significantly reduced postoperative nausea and vomiting after cervical surgery, suggesting a beneficial effect. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available for this indication, and no adverse effects were noted. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistent dosing guidelines.

studies.title: Early effects of peppermint oil on gastric emptying: a crossover study using a continuous real-time 13C breath test (BreathID system).
studies.notes: The study shows that peppermint oil enhances gastric emptying, indicating a beneficial effect for patients with gastrointestinal disorders.

indications.summary: One randomized crossover study suggests that peppermint oil (0.64 ml) may enhance gastric emptying in patients with gastrointestinal disorders, indicating a potential benefit for slow gastric emptying. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess safety and efficacy in broader populations.

studies.title: Efficacy and tolerability of a fixed combination of peppermint oil and caraway oil in patients suffering from functional dyspepsia.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in pain intensity and sensation of pressure, heaviness, and fullness, indicating a benefit from peppermint oil.

indications.summary: One randomized trial demonstrated that a fixed combination of peppermint oil (90 mg twice daily) and caraway oil significantly improved symptoms of functional dyspepsia, including pain intensity and sensations of pressure, heaviness, and fullness. No studies reported mixed outcomes or harm, suggesting a potential benefit for stomach discomfort, though further research may be needed to confirm these findings.

contraindications: adverse event rates were significantly higher with peppermint oil
mild adverse events more common in peppermint oil groups

studies.title: The effect of phosphatidylserine administration on memory and symptoms of attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder: a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study reports significant improvements in ADHD symptoms and memory, indicating a beneficial effect of phosphatidylserine supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial reported significant improvements in ADHD symptoms and memory with a daily dose of 200 mg of soy-derived phosphatidylserine over two months. Overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating benefit and no reports of harm or adverse effects. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistency.

studies.title: A soy-based phosphatidylserine/ phosphatidic acid complex (PAS) normalizes the stress reactivity of hypothalamus-pituitary-adrenal-axis in chronically stressed male subjects: a randomized, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study found that PAS 400 effectively normalized the stress response in chronically stressed subjects, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Omega-3 fatty acids administered in phosphatidylserine improved certain aspects of high chronic stress in men.
studies.notes: The study found no significant main effect on stress measures, but some benefit for high chronically stressed individuals, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for phosphatidylserine in managing chronic stress is limited and mixed. One randomized, placebo-controlled study reported a benefit with a soy-based phosphatidylserine complex at a dose of 400 mg daily for 42 days, while another study showed unclear results regarding its effectiveness in high chronic stress individuals. Overall, the findings do not provide strong support for its use in this indication.

studies.title: Acute cognitive effects of standardised Ginkgo biloba extract complexed with phosphatidylserine.
studies.notes: The study found that GBE complexed with phosphatidylserine improved cognitive performance, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Effects of a food supplement containing phosphatidylserine on cognitive function in Chinese older adults with mild cognitive impairment: A randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive functions, indicating a benefit from the supplement.

indications.summary: Phosphatidylserine has shown beneficial effects on cognitive function in two randomized trials. One study reported improvements in cognitive performance with a single dose of 120 mg complexed with Ginkgo biloba extract, while another study found significant cognitive improvements with a daily dose of 63 mg (31.5 mg per capsule, 2 capsules daily) over 12 months in older adults with mild cognitive impairment. No adverse effects were reported in the studies, but the overall evidence is limited to a small number of trials.

studies.title: Clinical usefulness of nutraceutics with acetyl-L-carnitine, α-lipoic acid, phosphatidylserine, curcumin, C, E and B-group vitamins in patients awaiting for carpal tunnel release during COVID-19 pandemic: a randomized controlled open label prospective study.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in symptoms and pain for patients with mild to moderate Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, indicating a benefit from the dietary integrator.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence from a single randomized controlled trial indicating that phosphatidylserine may provide benefit in reducing symptoms and pain in patients with mild to moderate carpal tunnel syndrome, with a reported dose of 600 mg twice daily for 60 days. However, the overall evidence is weak due to the small number of studies, and no adverse effects were reported in the trial.

studies.title: Effects of phosphatidylserine on exercise capacity during cycling in active males.
studies.notes: The study found a significant increase in exercise time to exhaustion, indicating a benefit from phosphatidylserine supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported that phosphatidylserine supplementation (750 mg daily for 10 days) significantly increased exercise time to exhaustion in active males, suggesting a potential benefit for low exercise performance. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Positive effects of soy lecithin-derived phosphatidylserine plus phosphatidic acid on memory, cognition, daily functioning, and mood in elderly patients with Alzheimer's disease and dementia.
studies.notes: The study showed a positive influence of phosphatidylserine on memory, mood, and cognition, indicating a benefit for the targeted conditions.

studies.title: Safety of phosphatidylserine containing omega-3 fatty acids in non-demented elderly: a double-blind placebo-controlled trial followed by an open-label extension.
studies.notes: The study found that PS-DHA is safe and well tolerated, with positive effects on cognitive function and no significant adverse effects reported.

studies.title: Phosphatidylserine containing omega-3 Fatty acids may improve memory abilities in nondemented elderly individuals with memory complaints: results from an open-label extension study.
studies.notes: The study reports significant improvements in cognitive performance, indicating a beneficial effect of phosphatidylserine.

studies.title: Phosphatidylserine containing omega-3 fatty acids may improve memory abilities in non-demented elderly with memory complaints: a double-blind placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study found significant improvements in cognitive performance, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

studies.title: The effect of phosphatidylserine-containing omega-3 fatty acids on memory abilities in subjects with subjective memory complaints: a pilot study.
studies.notes: The study reports a significant increase in memory recall, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: Human clinical evidence suggests that phosphatidylserine may have beneficial effects on memory and cognitive function in elderly individuals, particularly those with memory complaints or dementia. All five studies reviewed reported positive outcomes, with typical doses ranging from 100 mg to 300 mg daily. No significant adverse effects were noted, indicating a favorable safety profile; however, the overall quality and consistency of the evidence should be considered when interpreting these findings.

studies.title: Phosphatidylserine and caffeine attenuate postexercise mood disturbance and perception of fatigue in humans.
studies.notes: The study shows that Phosphatidylserine significantly attenuates postexercise mood disturbance and perception of fatigue, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that phosphatidylserine may significantly reduce postexercise mood disturbance and perception of fatigue when taken at a dose of 400 mg daily for two weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating a benefit and no reports of harm or mixed outcomes.

studies.title: A lecithin phosphatidylserine and phosphatidic acid complex (PAS) reduces symptoms of the premenstrual syndrome (PMS): Results of a randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in PMS symptoms with PAS treatment, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that a lecithin phosphatidylserine and phosphatidic acid complex (400 mg daily) may reduce symptoms of premenstrual syndrome (PMS), as indicated by one randomized, placebo-controlled trial. However, the overall evidence is sparse, with only one study reporting a benefit and no data on potential adverse effects or long-term safety.

studies.title: Influence of phosphatidylserine on cognitive performance and cortical activity after induced stress.
studies.notes: The study found that phosphatidylserine supplementation led to a significant decrease in Beta-1 power, indicating a potential benefit in cognitive performance and relaxation after stress.

studies.title: Effects of soy lecithin phosphatidic acid and phosphatidylserine complex (PAS) on the endocrine and psychological responses to mental stress.

doses.formulation: soy lecithin phosphatidic acid and phosphatidylserine complex

studies.notes: The study shows a benefit in reducing stress responses with the 400 mg dose of PAS.

indications.summary: Human clinical evidence suggests that phosphatidylserine may be beneficial for reducing stress responses, with two studies reporting positive outcomes. One study indicated benefits in cognitive performance and relaxation after stress, while another demonstrated reduced stress responses with a daily dose of 400 mg of a phosphatidylserine complex over three weeks. No adverse effects were reported, but the evidence is limited to a small number of studies, and further research is needed to confirm these findings.

contraindications: grade 3 or greater adverse events in 14.3% of patients
grade III infusion reaction related to bavituximab
treatment related-adverse events occurred in 45.7% of patients

studies.title: Efficacy of ETB-F01, Heat-Killed Akkermansia muciniphila Strain EB-AMDK19, in Patients with Respiratory Symptoms: A Multicenter Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in respiratory symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported a beneficial effect of heat-killed Akkermansia muciniphila strain EB-AMDK19 on respiratory symptoms in patients with cough, with treatment durations ranging from 4 to 12 weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Comparing the effects of yogurt containing Akkermansia muciniphilia postbiotic with yogurt containing Lactobacillus rhamnosus postbiotic on body composition, biochemical indices, appetite, and depression scores in overweight or obese adults: A randomized, double-blind, controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant reductions in various health parameters in the AMY group, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Supplementation with Akkermansia muciniphila in overweight and obese human volunteers: a proof-of-concept exploratory study.
studies.notes: The study shows that supplementation with A. muciniphila improves metabolic parameters, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Akkermansia muciniphila supplementation in patients with overweight/obese type 2 diabetes: Efficacy depends on its baseline levels in the gut.
studies.notes: The study shows mixed results based on baseline levels of Akkermansia muciniphila, with benefits in low baseline groups but not in high baseline groups.

studies.title: Investigation the effect of oleoylethanolamide supplementation on the abundance of Akkermansia muciniphila bacterium and the dietary intakes in people with obesity: A randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant increase in the abundance of Akkermansia muciniphila and a decrease in energy and carbohydrate intake, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: The evidence for Akkermansia muciniphila supplementation in reducing excess body weight is primarily positive, with three studies reporting benefits in metabolic parameters and body composition, while one study showed mixed results based on baseline gut levels of Akkermansia. Typical doses reported include daily intake of 10^10 bacteria for three months and yogurt containing Akkermansia for eight weeks. No adverse effects were noted in the reviewed studies.

studies.title: Akkermansia muciniphila and improved metabolic health during a dietary intervention in obesity: relationship with gut microbiome richness and ecology.
studies.notes: The study shows that higher A. muciniphila abundance is associated with improved metabolic parameters after calorie restriction, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that Akkermansia muciniphila may improve metabolic parameters related to high blood sugar in individuals undergoing calorie restriction. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Beneficial Effects of Akkermansia muciniphila Are Not Associated with Major Changes in the Circulating Endocannabinoidome but Linked to Higher Mono-Palmitoyl-Glycerol Levels as New PPARα Agonists.
studies.notes: The study shows beneficial effects of Akkermansia muciniphila on metabolic syndrome, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: One randomized trial has demonstrated beneficial effects of Akkermansia muciniphila on metabolic syndrome, with doses administered daily (either alive or pasteurized) for a duration of three months. No adverse effects or mixed outcomes were reported, but the evidence is limited to a single study, warranting caution in interpretation.

studies.title: Pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila HB05 (HB05P) Improves Muscle Strength and Function: A 12-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study reports significant improvements in muscle strength and functionality, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial found that pasteurized Akkermansia muciniphila HB05 at a dose of 1.0 × 10^10 cells daily for 12 weeks significantly improved muscle strength and functionality. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: The Short-Term Efficacy of Bifidobacterium Quadruple Viable Tablet in Patients With Diarrhea-Predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Potentially Mediated by Metabolism Rather Than Diversity Regulation.
studies.notes: The probiotics showed a significant improvement in response rates for abdominal pain and diarrhea, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: Current evidence from a randomized trial indicates that Bifidobacterium probiotics may improve abdominal pain and diarrhea in patients with diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome, with a significant response noted after 4 weeks of treatment. However, the overall evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Therapeutic Evaluation of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis MH-02 as an Adjunctive Treatment in Patients with Reflux Esophagitis: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant clinical improvement and symptom resolution in patients with reflux esophagitis, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic treatment.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial reported a beneficial effect of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis MH-02 in improving symptoms of reflux esophagitis over an 8-week period. No studies reported mixed outcomes or harm, but the overall evidence is limited to a single trial, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium breve M-16V regulates the autonomic nervous system via the intestinal environment: A double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study shows a positive effect on mood and sleep, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium longum subsp. longum Reduces Perceived Psychological Stress in Healthy Adults: An Exploratory Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in perceived stress and improvement in sleep quality, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic.

indications.summary: Clinical evidence suggests that probiotics containing Bifidobacterium may have a beneficial effect on anxiety-related outcomes, with two randomized trials reporting improvements in mood, sleep quality, and perceived psychological stress. Doses used in these studies ranged from 1 × 10^10 to 20 billion cells daily for a duration of 6 weeks. No adverse effects were reported, but the overall evidence is limited to a small number of studies, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis BLa80 regulates the intestinal habit in adults with chronic constipation: a multicentre, randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in stool consistency and frequency in the intervention group, indicating a beneficial outcome.

However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effects of Bifidobacterium breve 207-1 on regulating lifestyle behaviors and mental wellness in healthy adults based on the microbiome-gut-brain axis: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.

studies.title: Effects and Persistence of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis BL-99 and Fructooligosaccharides on Older Adults with Functional Constipation: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in bowel movements and gut transit time, indicating a beneficial effect on functional constipation.

indications.summary: The evidence for Bifidobacterium probiotics in treating constipation is low and mixed. One randomized trial reported significant improvements in bowel movements with Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis, while another study showed unclear outcomes regarding mood and lifestyle behaviors with Bifidobacterium breve. studies.title: Effects of Mesalamine Combined with Live Combined Bifidobacterium, Lactobacillus and Enterococcus Capsules on Intestinal Mucosa Barrier Function and Intestinal Microbiota in Mildly Active Crohn's Disease Patients.
studies.notes: The study shows a higher clinical effective rate and improved microbiota and inflammatory markers in the treatment group, indicating a benefit.

However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study reporting a benefit and no data on adverse effects or long-term outcomes.

studies.title: Clinical evaluation of paraprobiotic-associated Bifidobacterium lactis CCT 7858 anti-dandruff shampoo efficacy: A randomized placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study reports significant improvements in cleanliness and general appearance of dandruff, indicating a beneficial outcome.

No studies reported mixed outcomes or adverse effects, but the overall evidence is limited to a single trial, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings.

studies.title: Effectiveness of Psychobiotic Bifidobacterium breve BB05 in Managing Psychosomatic Diarrhea in College Students by Regulating Gut Microbiota: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in diarrhea symptoms and associated mental health issues, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic intervention.

No adverse effects were reported in this study, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish broader applicability.

studies.title: A randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of live Bifidobacterium longum CECT 7347 (ES1) and heat-treated Bifidobacterium longum CECT 7347 (HT-ES1) in participants with diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome.

However, the overall evidence is limited and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium breve Bif195 ameliorates aspirin-induced gastric mucosal damage: A randomised, double blind, placebo-controlled crossover trial.
studies.notes: Bif195 significantly reduced gastric mucosal damage compared to placebo, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover trial found that Bifidobacterium breve Bif195 significantly reduced aspirin-induced gastric mucosal damage at a dose of ≥1011 colony-forming units daily for 4 weeks.
