studies.title: The efficacy of Lacticaseibacillus paracasei MSMC39-1 and Bifidobacterium animalis TA-1 probiotics in modulating gut microbiota and reducing the risk of the characteristics of metabolic syndrome: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled study.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium adolescentis SBT2786 Improves Sleep Quality in Japanese Adults with Relatively High Levels of Stress: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study found that SBT2786 improved sleep duration and mood, particularly in stressed individuals, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Bifidobacterium breve CCFM1025 Improves Sleep Quality via Regulating the Activity of the HPA Axis: A Randomized Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant improvement in sleep quality in the group receiving Bifidobacterium breve CCFM1025 compared to placebo.

studies.title: Impact of probiotic Lactobacillus plantarum GKM3 on gastrointestinal health in overweight and obese individuals: A randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant benefits in gastrointestinal health and symptom alleviation in overweight and obese individuals after probiotic intervention.

studies.title: Lactobacillus casei Shirota probiotic drinks reduce antibiotic associated diarrhoea in patients with spinal cord injuries who regularly consume proton pump inhibitors: a subgroup analysis of the ECLISP multicentre RCT.

studies.notes: The study found a significant reduction in the incidence of antibiotic associated diarrhoea in the Lactobacillus group, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported that Lactobacillus casei Shirota probiotic drinks significantly reduced the incidence of antibiotic-associated diarrhea in patients with spinal cord injuries who were also taking proton pump inhibitors. The dose used was 6.5×10^9 live bacteria once daily during the antibiotic course and for 7 days thereafter. Overall, the evidence is limited to a single study with a specific population, and further research is needed to confirm these findings in broader populations.

studies.title: VagiBIOM Lactobacillus suppository improves vaginal health index in perimenopausal women with bacterial vaginosis: a randomized control trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in vaginal health outcomes, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

studies.title: Lactobacillus plantarum 24-7 improves postoperative bloating and hard stools by modulating intestinal microbiota in patients with congenital heart disease: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed marked differences in bloating and hard stool scores, but overall GSRS scores did not reach statistical significance, indicating mixed outcomes.

studies.title: Therapeutic Value of Lactobacillus gasseri 345A in Chronic Constipation.
studies.notes: The study reports a significant reduction in abdominal pain and a tendency for increased complete spontaneous bowel movements, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial has reported a beneficial effect of Lactobacillus gasseri in reducing abdominal pain and potentially increasing complete spontaneous bowel movements in patients with chronic constipation. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the consistency of the effects across different populations and doses.

studies.title: Supplementation with heat-sterilized Lactobacillus crispatus strain KT-11 stimulates the T cell-related immune function of healthy Japanese adults: A pilot randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind, parallel-group study.
studies.notes: The study showed a significant increase in T cell counts and fewer self-reported cold-like symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect on immune function.

indications.summary: One pilot randomized controlled trial suggests that supplementation with heat-sterilized Lactobacillus crispatus strain KT-11 may enhance T cell-related immune function and reduce self-reported cold-like symptoms in healthy adults. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the consistency of the effects.

studies.title: Lactobacillus helveticus Induces Two Types of Dendritic Cell Activation and Effectively Suppresses Onset of the Common Cold: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in symptoms of the common cold, indicating a beneficial effect of Lactobacillus helveticus.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial indicates that Lactobacillus helveticus may reduce symptoms of the common cold, with a reported dose of 6 billion capsules daily for 8 weeks. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess consistency across different populations and formulations.

studies.title: Lactobacillus paragasseri SBT2055 Activates Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells and Improves Subjective Symptoms of Common Cold in Healthy Adults: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Parallel-Group Comparative Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that LG2055 significantly improved symptoms of the common cold, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial found that Lactobacillus paragasseri SBT2055 significantly improved subjective symptoms of the common cold in healthy adults when taken at a dose of 3 capsules once daily for 12 weeks. Overall, the evidence suggests a potential benefit, but further studies are needed to confirm these findings and assess consistency across different populations and formulations.

studies.title: Improvement of Post-Surgery Constipation in Patients with Fractures by Lactobacillus rhamnosus JYLR-127: A Single-Blind Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated that Lactobacillus rhamnosus improved constipation symptoms, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial found that Lactobacillus rhamnosus improved constipation symptoms in post-surgery patients with fractures, indicating a potential benefit. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to establish consistency and generalizability of these findings. No adverse effects were reported in the study.

studies.title: Effects of Mesalamine Combined with Live Combined Bifidobacterium, Lactobacillus and Enterococcus Capsules on Intestinal Mucosa Barrier Function and Intestinal Microbiota in Mildly Active Crohn's Disease Patients.

doses.formulation: Live combined Bifidobacterium, Lactobacillus and Enterococcus capsules

studies.notes: The study shows a higher clinical effective rate and improved microbiota and inflammatory markers in the treatment group, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that probiotics, specifically Lactobacillus in combination with other strains, may improve symptoms in patients with mildly active Crohn's disease, as indicated by one study showing a higher clinical effective rate and improved microbiota and inflammatory markers. However, the overall evidence is sparse, and further research is needed to establish consistency and efficacy. No adverse effects were reported in the available study.

studies.title: The Probiotic Effects of Lactobacillus brevis CD2 on Caries Related Variables of Dental Plaque Biofilm.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in plaque acidogenicity, indicating a beneficial effect of L. brevis CD2.

indications.summary: Current evidence suggests that Lactobacillus brevis CD2 may have a beneficial effect on dental caries by significantly reducing plaque acidogenicity, as reported in one randomized trial. The study utilized a dose of 1 to 2 lozenges taken three times daily for 28 days. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating a positive outcome and no data on potential adverse effects.

studies.title: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled clinical trial on Lactobacillus-containing cultured milk drink as adjuvant therapy for depression in irritable bowel syndrome.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in depression scores and quality of life among IBS patients receiving probiotics.

studies.title: Probiotic Lactobacillus plantarum 299v supplementation in patients with major depression in a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial: A metabolomics study.
studies.notes: The study suggests potential metabolic pathways influenced by LP299v supplementation, but definitive conclusions cannot be drawn due to the exploratory nature of the research.

indications.summary: The evidence for Lactobacillus probiotics in the treatment of depression is limited and mixed. One randomized controlled trial reported significant improvements in depression scores among patients with irritable bowel syndrome, while another study suggested potential metabolic effects but lacked definitive conclusions. Overall, the findings do not provide strong support for the use of probiotics in depression, and further research is needed to clarify their efficacy.

studies.title: A 12-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Lactobacillus plantarum LMT1-48 on Body Fat Loss.
studies.notes: The study shows significant reduction in body fat mass, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study found that Lactobacillus plantarum LMT1-48 significantly reduced body fat mass over 12 weeks, indicating a potential benefit for excess body weight. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Efficacy and Safety of Postbiotic Contained Inactivated Lactobacillus reuteri ( Limosilactobacillus reuteri ) DSM 17648 as Adjuvant Therapy in the Eradication of Helicobacter pylori in Adults With Functional Dyspepsia: A Randomized Double-Blind Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in eradication efficiency and a lower number of digestive adverse effects, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

indications.summary: One randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial indicates that postbiotic inactivated Lactobacillus reuteri (200 mg bid for 14 days) may improve eradication efficiency of Helicobacter pylori and reduce digestive adverse effects in adults with functional dyspepsia. Overall, the evidence is limited to a single study showing benefit, with no reports of harm or no benefit.

studies.title: The Beneficial Effects of Regular Intake of Lactobacillus paragasseri OLL2716 on Gastric Discomfort in Healthy Adults: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in gastric symptoms and mental stress, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study found that daily intake of 85 g of yogurt containing Lactobacillus paragasseri OLL2716 for 12 weeks significantly improved gastric discomfort in healthy adults. Overall, the evidence is limited to this single study, indicating a potential benefit but lacking consistency across multiple trials. No adverse effects were reported in the study.

studies.title: Study of the effect of Lactobacillus crispatus FSCDJY67L3 on Helicobacter Pylori eradication: a double-blind randomized controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant reduction in H. pylori load and improvement in gastrointestinal symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial indicates that Lactobacillus crispatus may reduce Helicobacter pylori load and improve gastrointestinal symptoms, suggesting a potential benefit for gastrointestinal discomfort. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess consistency across different populations and dosages.

studies.title: A tangible prospect for the treatment of gingivitis using a potentially probiotic strain Lactobacillus plantarum MK06 isolated from traditional dairy products: a triple blind randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed a significant difference in gingival index at week four, but overall differences were not significant, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for the use of Lactobacillus probiotics in treating gingivitis is low quality, with one randomized trial reporting mixed outcomes. Although a significant difference in the gingival index was observed at week four, overall differences were not statistically significant, indicating uncertainty regarding the efficacy of this intervention. No adverse effects were reported in the study.

studies.title: Beneficial Effect of Heat-Killed Lactic Acid Bacterium Lactobacillus johnsonii No. 1088 on Temporal Gastroesophageal Reflux-Related Symptoms in Healthy Volunteers: A Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group Study.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant improvement in heartburn symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

studies.title: Efficacy of a Food Supplement Containing Lactobacillus acidophilus LA14, Peptides, and a Multivitamin Complex in Improving Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease-Related Outcomes and Quality of Life of Subjects Showing Mild-to-Moderate Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.
studies.notes: The study reported significant improvements in heartburn frequency, severity, and quality of life, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: Clinical evidence from two randomized trials indicates that probiotics, specifically Lactobacillus strains, may improve heartburn symptoms and quality of life in individuals with gastroesophageal reflux disease. One study utilized a daily dose of 1 billion heat-killed Lactobacillus johnsonii for six weeks, while the other involved a food supplement containing Lactobacillus acidophilus over 28 days; however, specific doses for the latter were not reported. No adverse effects were noted in the studies, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish optimal dosing.

studies.title: Impact of Lactocaseibacillus (Lactobacillus) paracasei sup. paracasei TISTR 2593 Probiotic Supplementation on the Gut Microbiome of Hypercholesterolemia Patients: A Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant reduction in LDL-C levels, indicating a beneficial effect on metabolic health.

studies.title: Distinct Microbial Taxa Are Associated with LDL-Cholesterol Reduction after 12 Weeks of Lactobacillus plantarum Intake in Mild Hypercholesterolemia: Results of a Randomized Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study found a significant reduction in LDL-C in the Lactobacillus plantarum group compared to placebo, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: Two randomized controlled trials have reported beneficial effects of Lactobacillus probiotics on LDL cholesterol levels in patients with hypercholesterolemia, with doses of 1 daily and 1.2 ×10^9 CFU daily for 90 days and 12 weeks, respectively. No studies reported mixed or harmful outcomes, suggesting a potential positive impact on LDL cholesterol; however, the overall evidence remains limited and further research is needed to confirm these findings.

studies.title: Effectiveness of vaginal probiotics Lactobacillus crispatus chen-01 in women with high-risk HPV infection: a prospective controlled pilot study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant reduction in HPV viral load and improved clearance rates, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotic intervention.

indications.summary: One pilot study reported a beneficial effect of intravaginal Lactobacillus crispatus chen-01 on reducing HPV viral load and improving clearance rates in women with high-risk HPV infection. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the consistency and safety of this intervention.

studies.title: Lactobacillus acidophilus ameliorates cholestatic liver injury through inhibiting bile acid synthesis and promoting bile acid excretion.
studies.notes: The study shows that Lactobacillus acidophilus treatment improves liver function in cholestatic patients, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Effects of Lactobacillus paracasei N1115 on gut microbial imbalance and liver function in patients with hepatitis B-related cirrhosis.
studies.notes: The intervention led to significant improvements in liver function and microbial diversity, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: Current evidence from two studies suggests that Lactobacillus probiotics may improve liver function in patients with cholestatic liver injury and hepatitis B-related cirrhosis. Both studies report beneficial outcomes without any noted adverse effects. However, the overall quality of evidence is limited, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish optimal dosing.

studies.title: Efficacy of Lactococcus lactis subsp. lactis LY-66 and Lactobacillus plantarum PL-02 in Enhancing Explosive Strength and Endurance: A Randomized, Double-Blinded Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant enhancements in exercise performance and muscle strength, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotics.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported a beneficial effect of Lactobacillus probiotics on exercise performance and muscle strength over a six-week period. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess consistency across different populations and doses.

studies.title: Effect of lactobacillus reuteri-derived probiotic nano-formulation on recurrent aphthous stomatitis: a double-blinded randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The probiotic group showed significant improvements in lesion size and pain severity compared to the control group, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial found that a topical probiotic nano-formulation of Lactobacillus reuteri applied three times a day for seven days resulted in significant improvements in lesion size and pain severity in patients with recurrent aphthous stomatitis. No studies reported mixed or negative outcomes, but the evidence is limited to a single trial, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Probiotic Lactobacillus fermentum TSF331, Lactobacillus reuteri TSR332, and Lactobacillus plantarum TSP05 improved liver function and uric acid management-A pilot study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant reductions in liver function markers and uric acid levels, indicating a beneficial effect of the probiotics.

indications.summary: One pilot study reported that a multi-strain probiotic formulation containing Lactobacillus fermentum, Lactobacillus reuteri, and Lactobacillus plantarum improved liver function markers and uric acid levels over a 60-day period. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Lactobacillus paragasseri OLL2809 Improves Premenstrual Psychological Symptoms in Healthy Women: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in premenstrual symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study found that Lactobacillus paragasseri OLL2809 improved premenstrual psychological symptoms in healthy women over three menstrual cycles. No adverse effects were reported, but the evidence is limited to a single study, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings.

studies.title: Response to Antibiotic Treatment of Bacterial Vaginosis Predicts the Effectiveness of LACTIN-V (Lactobacillus crispatus CTV-05) in the Prevention of Recurrent Disease.
studies.notes: The study shows that LACTIN-V decreases BV recurrence in women who achieved clinical cure after antibiotic treatment, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that Lactobacillus crispatus (LACTIN-V) may reduce the recurrence of bacterial vaginosis in women who have achieved clinical cure after antibiotic treatment. The evidence is limited to this single study, and no adverse effects were reported. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistent dosing guidelines.

studies.title: Effects of a supplement associating Lactobacillus strains and proanthocyanidin-rich plant extracts against recurrent uncomplicated, urinary tract infections: A prospective, controlled study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant benefits in reducing recurrence and improving quality of life for women with recurrent cystitis.

indications.summary: One study has shown that a supplement combining Lactobacillus strains and proanthocyanidin-rich plant extracts may significantly reduce the recurrence of uncomplicated urinary tract infections and improve quality of life in women with recurrent cystitis when taken daily for six months. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Lactobacillus probiotics restore vaginal and gut microbiota of pregnant women with vaginal candidiasis.
studies.notes: The administration of probiotics showed beneficial effects in preventing shifts in microbiota associated with vaginal candidiasis.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that Lactobacillus probiotics may have beneficial effects in restoring vaginal and gut microbiota in pregnant women with vaginal candidiasis, using a dose of 2 capsules twice a day for 8 weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating a positive outcome and no reports of harm or mixed results.

studies.title: Lactobacillus gasseri CECT 30648 shows probiotic characteristics and colonizes the vagina of healthy women after oral administration.
studies.notes: The study shows that L. gasseri CECT 30648 can colonize the vaginal tract and improve vaginal microbiota, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: Current evidence suggests that Lactobacillus gasseri CECT 30648 may benefit vaginal dysbiosis by colonizing the vaginal tract and improving microbiota, based on a single study with a dose of 10^9 CFU daily for up to 18 days. However, the overall evidence is limited, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effect of Red Yeast Rice on Cognitive Functioning in Schizophrenia: Data From a Pilot Study.

indications.summary: There is low-quality evidence suggesting that Red Yeast Rice may improve cognitive functioning in individuals with schizophrenia, based on a pilot study that reported significant benefits with a daily dose of 200 mg over 12 weeks. However, due to the limited number of studies and the specific population examined, the overall evidence for its efficacy in cognitive impairment or memory problems is insufficient and should be interpreted with caution.

studies.title: Tolerability of red yeast rice (2,400 mg twice daily) versus pravastatin (20 mg twice daily) in patients with previous statin intolerance.
studies.notes: The study shows no significant difference in pain severity or muscle strength between red yeast rice and pravastatin, indicating mixed outcomes regarding tolerability.

studies.notes: The study showed a significant reduction in Lp-PLA2, indicating a potential benefit for cardiovascular health in patients with metabolic syndrome.

indications.summary: Red yeast rice has been shown to significantly reduce LDL cholesterol levels in multiple randomized controlled trials, with beneficial outcomes reported across various doses, typically ranging from 10 mg to 2400 mg daily. While the evidence is predominantly positive, one study indicated mixed outcomes regarding tolerability compared to pravastatin, suggesting the need for caution in specific populations. Overall, the evidence supports its use for managing high LDL cholesterol, but further research may be warranted to fully understand its safety profile.

studies.title: Effects of a New Nutraceutical Formulation (Berberine, Red Yeast Rice and Chitosan) on Non-HDL Cholesterol Levels in Individuals with Dyslipidemia: Results from a Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The intervention significantly decreased non-HDL cholesterol and other lipid parameters, indicating a benefit for dyslipidemic individuals.

indications.summary: Red yeast rice has shown a beneficial effect on non-HDL cholesterol levels in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study, where it was part of a formulation that also included berberine, chitosan, and coenzyme Q. The study reported a significant decrease in non-HDL cholesterol among dyslipidemic individuals, although the specific contribution of red yeast rice alone is not isolated in the findings. No adverse effects were noted in the reported evidence, but further studies are needed to confirm these results and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: Red yeast rice induces less muscle fatigue symptom than simvastatin in dyslipidemic patients: a single center randomized pilot trial.
studies.notes: Red yeast rice showed less muscle fatigue compared to simvastatin, indicating a benefit in managing muscle-related side effects in dyslipidemic patients.

indications.summary: One randomized pilot trial found that red yeast rice resulted in less muscle fatigue compared to simvastatin in dyslipidemic patients over a 4-week period, suggesting a potential benefit for managing muscle-related side effects. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

contraindications: elevated liver enzymes in two subjects
increased risk of adverse health outcomes related to uric acid, alanine transaminase and aspartate transaminase levels

studies.title: Effects of Mediterranean Diet, Curcumin, and Resveratrol on Mild-to-Moderate Active Ulcerative Colitis: A Multicenter Randomized Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed that the interventions were effective in reducing disease activity and improving quality of life in patients with ulcerative colitis, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported that resveratrol (500 mg daily for 8 weeks) was effective in reducing disease activity and improving quality of life in patients with mild-to-moderate active ulcerative colitis. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating a benefit and no reports of harm or mixed outcomes. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Combined Rehabilitation with Alpha Lipoic Acid, Acetyl-L-Carnitine, Resveratrol, and Cholecalciferolin Discogenic Sciatica in Young People: A Randomized Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows statistically significant improvements in pain and quality of life, indicating a benefit from the treatment including Resveratrol.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that resveratrol may provide benefits for back pain, as indicated by one randomized clinical trial that reported statistically significant improvements in pain and quality of life with a daily dose of 50 mg over 30 days. However, the overall evidence is sparse, and further studies are needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Sirtuin 1 and Vascular Function in Healthy Women and Men: A Randomized Clinical Trial Comparing the Effects of Energy Restriction and Resveratrol.
studies.notes: The study shows that resveratrol increased circulating SIRT1 and reduced sympathetic activity, indicating a beneficial effect on vascular function.

indications.summary: Current evidence on resveratrol for cardiometabolic diseases is limited but suggests a potential benefit in vascular function, as indicated by a randomized clinical trial showing increased circulating SIRT1 and reduced sympathetic activity after 30 days of supplementation. No adverse effects or harm were reported, but the overall evidence remains sparse and requires further investigation to establish consistency and efficacy.

studies.title: Resveratrol Attenuates CSF Markers of Neurodegeneration and Neuroinflammation in Individuals with Alzheimer's Disease.
studies.notes: The study shows that resveratrol reduced markers of neurodegeneration and inflammation in Alzheimer's disease, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized trial indicates that resveratrol may reduce cerebrospinal fluid markers of neurodegeneration and neuroinflammation in individuals with Alzheimer's disease, suggesting a potential benefit for cognitive impairment. However, the evidence is limited to this single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effects of resveratrol on inflammatory cytokines in COVID-19 patients: a randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant reductions in inflammatory markers and blood glucose levels, indicating a beneficial effect of resveratrol in COVID-19 patients.

studies.title: Randomized double-blind placebo-controlled proof-of-concept trial of resveratrol for outpatient treatment of mild coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
studies.notes: The study showed a lower incidence of hospitalization and ER visits in the resveratrol group compared to placebo, indicating a potential benefit.

indications.summary: Two randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials suggest potential benefits of resveratrol in COVID-19 patients, including reductions in inflammatory markers and lower rates of hospitalization and emergency room visits. The doses reported include 750 mg daily for 10 days in one study. However, the overall evidence remains limited and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Resveratrol alters oral biofilm in vitro and in vivo.
studies.notes: Resveratrol significantly reduced biofilm metabolic activity and mutans streptococci, indicating a beneficial effect on dental caries.

indications.summary: One study indicates that resveratrol may reduce biofilm metabolic activity and mutans streptococci, suggesting a potential benefit for dental caries at a dose of 100 mg/L over 7 weeks. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: A Randomized Trial on Resveratrol Supplement Affecting Lipid Profile and Other Metabolic Markers in Subjects with Dyslipidemia.
studies.notes: Resveratrol did not significantly change the lipid profile but decreased uric acid levels, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for resveratrol in improving dyslipidemia is low and mixed, with a single randomized trial indicating that while resveratrol did not significantly alter lipid profiles, it did reduce uric acid levels. Doses in this study ranged from 100 mg to 600 mg daily over 8 weeks. Overall, the findings do not support a clear benefit for dyslipidemia management.

studies.title: [Effects of zinc and resveratrol as modulators of leptin response in adults with obesity].
studies.notes: The study indicates a benefit in modulating leptin and glucose signaling in obese individuals, suggesting positive health outcomes.

studies.title: Treatment with combined resveratrol and myoinositol ameliorates endocrine, metabolic alterations and perceived stress response in women with PCOS: a double-blind randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in endocrine and metabolic parameters, indicating a beneficial effect of resveratrol in PCOS management.

indications.summary: Clinical evidence suggests that resveratrol may have beneficial effects on metabolic parameters related to excess body weight, as indicated by two randomized trials. Doses reported include 500 mg daily for 60 days and 2000 mg daily (1000 mg twice daily) for 12 weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited to a small number of studies, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: Effects of resveratrol supplementation on inflammatory markers, fatigue scale, fasting blood sugar and lipid profile in relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis patients: a double-blind, randomized placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: Resveratrol supplementation showed significant anti-inflammatory effects, particularly in reducing TNF-α and MDA levels, indicating a benefit for MS patients.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence from a single double-blind, randomized placebo-controlled trial indicating that resveratrol supplementation (500 mg daily for 8 weeks) may reduce fatigue in patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis through anti-inflammatory effects. Overall, the evidence is not robust, and further studies are needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Resveratrol decreases local inflammatory markers and systemic endotoxin in patients with aggressive periodontitis.
studies.notes: The study shows that Resveratrol improves symptoms of periodontitis and decreases inflammatory markers, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Impact of resveratrol supplementation on clinical parameters and inflammatory markers in patients with chronic periodontitis: a randomized clinical trail.
studies.notes: Resveratrol showed a significant effect on plaque index but no significant differences in other clinical parameters or inflammatory markers, indicating mixed outcomes.

studies.title: Impact of systemic resveratrol on non-surgical periodontal treatment of smokers: A 12-month randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that systemic administration of resveratrol improves clinical outcomes in smokers with periodontitis, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: The evidence for resveratrol in the treatment of gum disease is mixed. Two studies indicate a benefit, showing improvements in inflammatory markers and clinical outcomes, while one study presents unclear results regarding its effectiveness on various clinical parameters. Doses reported include 125 mg, 250 mg, and 500 mg daily, but further research is needed to clarify its overall efficacy and consistency in this indication.

studies.title: Effects of resveratrol supplementation on cardiac remodeling in hypertensive patients: a randomized controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that resveratrol supplementation can alleviate left atrial remodeling and improve left ventricular diastolic function, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial indicates that resveratrol supplementation (400 mg daily for 6 months) may benefit cardiac remodeling and diastolic function in hypertensive patients. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study reporting a positive outcome and no data on adverse effects or consistency across multiple studies.

studies.title: The Administration of Resveratrol and Vitamin C Reduces Oxidative Stress in Postmenopausal Women-A Pilot Randomized Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant decrease in oxidative stress markers and an increase in total antioxidant capacity, indicating a beneficial effect of resveratrol and vitamin C in postmenopausal women.

studies.title: Effect of Resveratrol on Markers of Oxidative Stress and Sirtuin 1 in Elderly Adults with Type 2 Diabetes.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant increase in antioxidant capacity and sirtuin 1 levels with 1000 mg/day of Resveratrol, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: Two randomized clinical trials indicate that resveratrol may have beneficial effects on oxidative stress markers and antioxidant capacity in individuals with Type 2 diabetes, with one study reporting positive outcomes at doses of 500 mg to 1000 mg daily over six months. However, the evidence is limited and does not establish a clear consensus on its efficacy for managing high blood sugar specifically, as no studies directly assessed blood glucose levels. No adverse effects were reported in the studies reviewed.

studies.title: Resveratrol ameliorates mitochondrial biogenesis and reproductive outcomes in women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing assisted reproduction: a randomized, triple-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: Resveratrol showed significant improvements in oxidative stress markers and reproductive outcomes in women with PCOS, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized, triple-blind, placebo-controlled trial found that resveratrol (800 mg daily for 60 days) improved oxidative stress markers and reproductive outcomes in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). No studies reported mixed or harmful effects, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: Equol and Resveratrol Improve Bone Turnover Biomarkers in Postmenopausal Women: A Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in bone turnover biomarkers and BMD, indicating a beneficial effect of resveratrol.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial has reported a beneficial effect of resveratrol on bone turnover biomarkers and bone mineral density (BMD) in postmenopausal women, with a dose of 25 mg used over 12 months. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available, and no adverse effects were reported. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish the efficacy of resveratrol for low bone density.

studies.title: Effects of resveratrol on aortic growth in patients with Marfan syndrome: a single-arm open-label multicentre trial.
studies.notes: The study suggests a trend towards stabilization of aortic growth rate, but the results are not definitive, indicating a mixed outcome direction.

indications.summary: The evidence for resveratrol in the treatment of Marfan syndrome is limited and of low quality, with only one study reporting mixed outcomes. This single-arm open-label trial suggested a potential trend towards stabilization of aortic growth over one year, but the results are not definitive. No consistent dose ranges were reported, and there were no noted adverse effects.

studies.title: Role of δ-tocotrienol and resveratrol supplementation in the regulation of micro RNAs in patients with metabolic syndrome: A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in miRNA expression related to metabolic syndrome, indicating a beneficial effect of resveratrol supplementation.

studies.title: δ-Tocotrienol in Combination with Resveratrol Improves the Cardiometabolic Risk Factors and Biomarkers in Patients with Metabolic Syndrome: A Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in cardiometabolic risk factors and biomarkers, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

indications.summary: Two randomized controlled trials have reported beneficial effects of resveratrol supplementation (150 mg twice daily for 24 weeks) on metabolic syndrome, specifically in improving miRNA expression and cardiometabolic risk factors. There is no evidence of harm or no benefit, but the overall evidence is limited to these studies, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects.

studies.title: Effect of Resveratrol on Endothelial Function in Patients with CKD and Diabetes: A Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: Resveratrol supplementation improved endothelial function, indicating a beneficial effect on cardiovascular health in the studied population.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported that resveratrol supplementation at a dose of 400 mg daily for 6 weeks improved endothelial function in patients with chronic kidney disease and diabetes, suggesting a potential benefit for cardiovascular health. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Increase in plasma resveratrol levels and in acid-resistant proteins in the acquired enamel pellicle after use of resveratrol-containing orodispersible tablets.
studies.notes: The study shows that trans-resveratrol increases bioavailability and expression of beneficial proteins, indicating a positive health outcome.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that resveratrol may improve oral health, as indicated by a single study showing an increase in plasma resveratrol levels and beneficial proteins in the acquired enamel pellicle following the use of a 15 mg orodispersible tablet. However, the overall evidence is sparse, and further research is needed to establish consistent benefits and safety.

studies.title: Integrative skincare trial of intense pulsed light followed by the phyto-corrective mask, phyto-corrective gel, and resveratrol BE for decreasing post-procedure downtime and improving procedure outcomes in patients with rosacea.
studies.notes: The study shows that the addition of resveratrol improves treatment outcomes for rosacea, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: The evidence for resveratrol in the treatment of rosacea is limited, with only one study reporting a benefit when used in conjunction with other treatments over a three-month period. The findings suggest a potential positive effect, but the overall quality and quantity of evidence are low, and further research is needed to confirm these results.

contraindications: ALT increased in older adults following resveratrol supplementation.
High-dose supplementation (>1,000 mg/day) appeared to increase alkaline phosphatase concentration.

studies.title: The Effects of Rhodiola rosea L. Extract on Anxiety, Stress, Cognition and Other Mood Symptoms.
studies.notes: The study showed significant reductions in anxiety, stress, and mood symptoms, indicating a beneficial effect of Rhodiola rosea extract.

studies.title: A pilot study of Rhodiola rosea (Rhodax) for generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
studies.notes: Significant improvement in GAD symptoms was observed, indicating a benefit from the treatment with R. rosea.

indications.summary: Clinical evidence from two randomized trials indicates that Rhodiola rosea may have beneficial effects on anxiety symptoms. One study reported significant reductions in anxiety and mood symptoms with a dose of 200 mg twice daily, while another study found improvements in generalized anxiety disorder symptoms with a daily dose of 340 mg. No adverse effects were reported, but further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish optimal dosing.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea in Subjects with Prolonged or Chronic Fatigue Symptoms: Results of an Open-Label Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed statistically significant improvement in fatigue symptoms, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

indications.summary: The evidence for Rhodiola Rosea in treating chronic fatigue is limited, with only one open-label clinical trial reporting a statistically significant improvement in fatigue symptoms at a dose of 200 mg twice daily for 8 weeks. Overall, the quality of evidence is low, and no adverse effects were reported in the study. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish the efficacy of this supplement.

studies.title: Efficacy and tolerability of a Rhodiola rosea extract in adults with physical and cognitive deficiencies.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in physical and cognitive deficiencies, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

indications.summary: There is low-quality evidence suggesting that Rhodiola Rosea may improve cognitive function in adults with physical and cognitive deficiencies, based on one study that reported significant benefits with doses of 1 to 2 capsules daily over 12 weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea versus sertraline for major depressive disorder: A randomized placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: R. rosea showed less antidepressant effect compared to sertraline but resulted in fewer adverse events, indicating a mixed outcome.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea (SHR-5), Part 2: A standardized extract of Rhodiola rosea is shown to be effective in the treatment of mild to moderate depression.
studies.notes: The study indicates effectiveness in treating mild to moderate depression, thus classified as a benefit.

studies.title: Clinical trial of Rhodiola rosea L. extract SHR-5 in the treatment of mild to moderate depression.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in depressive symptoms with no serious side effects, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

indications.summary: The evidence for Rhodiola rosea in treating depression is mixed. Two studies reported benefits in mild to moderate depression, with one study indicating less effectiveness compared to sertraline but fewer adverse events. Doses reported include 340 mg and 680 mg taken twice daily for 6 weeks, and a standardized extract used for 12 weeks; however, the overall effectiveness compared to standard treatments remains unclear.

studies.title: The influence of supplementation with Rhodiola rosea L. extract on selected redox parameters in professional rowers.
studies.notes: The study showed increased antioxidant levels but no effect on oxidative damage, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding Rhodiola Rosea for exercise performance is limited and mixed, with one study indicating increased antioxidant levels but no effect on oxidative damage. The typical dose reported was 100 mg of extract twice daily for four weeks. Overall, the findings do not support a clear benefit for exercise performance.

studies.title: Effects of Short-Term Golden Root Extract (Rhodiola rosea) Supplementation on Resistance Exercise Performance.
studies.notes: The study shows that GRE enhances explosive performance but impairs endurance, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding Rhodiola Rosea for explosive resistance training performance is limited and mixed. One study reported that a daily dose of 1500 mg of Golden Root Extract may enhance explosive performance but also impair endurance, indicating potential trade-offs. Overall, there are no consistent benefits reported, and further research is needed to clarify its effects.

studies.title: A randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study of the standardised extract shr-5 of the roots of Rhodiola rosea in the treatment of subjects with stress-related fatigue.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in fatigue and mental performance, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea for mental and physical fatigue in nursing students: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study found that Rhodiola rosea worsened fatigue compared to placebo, indicating harm.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea in stress induced fatigue--a double blind cross-over study of a standardized extract SHR-5 with a repeated low-dose regimen on the mental performance of healthy physicians during night duty.
studies.notes: The study showed a statistically significant improvement in mental performance, indicating a benefit from Rhodiola Rosea in reducing fatigue.

studies.title: Effects of the Combined Supplementation of Caffeine and Rhodiola Rosea with Resistance Training on Lower Limb Explosive Power in Male Volleyball Players.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in performance metrics and fatigue recovery, indicating a beneficial outcome from the supplementation.

studies.title: Rhodiola rosea (SHR-5), Part I: a proprietary root extract of Rhodiola rosea is found to be effective in the treatment of stress-related fatigue.
studies.notes: The study indicates a benefit in treating stress-related fatigue, as stated in the title.

indications.summary: The evidence for Rhodiola Rosea in reducing fatigue is mixed, with four studies reporting benefits and one study indicating harm. Doses reported include 576 mg daily for 28 days and 364 mg daily for 42 days, among others. Caution is warranted due to the adverse effects noted in one trial, which found that Rhodiola worsened fatigue compared to placebo.

studies.title: Effects of short-term Rhodiola Rosea (Golden Root Extract) supplementation on anaerobic exercise performance.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated that GRE supplementation improved various measures of anaerobic performance, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Acute Rhodiola rosea intake can improve endurance exercise performance.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant improvement in endurance exercise capacity and related parameters with acute Rhodiola rosea intake, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: The effects of an acute dose of Rhodiola rosea on endurance exercise performance.
studies.notes: The study shows that Rhodiola rosea ingestion improves endurance performance and reduces perceived exertion, indicating a beneficial effect on exercise outcomes.

studies.title: Effects of chronic Rhodiola Rosea supplementation on sport performance and antioxidant capacity in trained male: preliminary results.
studies.notes: The study showed mixed results; while some performance parameters were unaffected, there were significant reductions in lactate and muscle damage indicators, indicating potential benefits in specific areas.

indications.summary: The evidence for Rhodiola Rosea in improving low exercise performance is primarily positive, with three studies reporting benefits in anaerobic and endurance performance at doses ranging from 200 mg to 1500 mg. However, one study presented mixed results, indicating that while some performance measures may improve, others remain unchanged. Overall, the findings suggest potential benefits, but the evidence is not entirely consistent.

studies.title: A double-blind, placebo-controlled pilot study of the stimulating and adaptogenic effect of Rhodiola rosea SHR-5 extract on the fatigue of students caused by stress during an examination period with a repeated low-dose regimen.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in physical fitness and mental fatigue, indicating a benefit from the supplement.

studies.title: The Impact of Rhodiola Rosea Extract on Strength Performance in Alternative Bench-Press and Bench-Pull Exercises Under Resting and Mental Fatigue Conditions: A Randomized, Triple-Blinded, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that Rhodiola Rosea supplementation has beneficial effects on strength performance, particularly under control conditions, with no reported adverse effects.

studies.title: A randomized trial of two different doses of a SHR-5 Rhodiola rosea extract versus placebo and control of capacity for mental work.
studies.notes: The study showed a statistically significant antifatigue effect, indicating a benefit from the supplement.

indications.summary: Clinical evidence from three randomized trials indicates that Rhodiola Rosea may have beneficial effects on mental fatigue, with significant improvements reported in physical fitness and mental work capacity. The studies utilized doses of standardized SHR-5 extract, with varying amounts of 2 to 3 capsules or low repeated doses over several days. No adverse effects were reported, but the overall evidence is limited to a small number of studies and should be interpreted cautiously.

studies.title: The influence of supplementation with Rhodiola rosea L. extract on selected redox parameters in professional rowers.
studies.notes: The study showed increased antioxidant levels but no effect on oxidative damage, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: The evidence for Rhodiola Rosea in reducing oxidative stress is low and mixed. One study reported increased antioxidant levels but no significant effect on oxidative damage, suggesting unclear outcomes. The typical dose reported was 100 mg of extract twice daily for four weeks.

studies.title: Therapeutic effects and safety of Rhodiola rosea extract WS® 1375 in subjects with life-stress symptoms--results of an open-label study.
studies.notes: The study reported clinically relevant improvements in life-stress symptoms, indicating a beneficial outcome.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that Rhodiola Rosea may improve life-stress symptoms, as indicated by one open-label study that reported benefits with a dose of 200 mg twice daily for 4 weeks. However, the overall quality of evidence is low, and further randomized controlled trials are needed to confirm these findings and assess safety and efficacy more robustly.

contraindications: may affect drugs with a narrow therapeutic index like phenytoin and warfarin
more subjects on sertraline reported adverse events (63.2%) than R. rosea (30.0%) or placebo (16.7%)

studies.title: Effectiveness of a Saffron and Withania Supplement on Mood in Women With Mild-to-Moderate Anxiety During the COVID-19 Lockdown.
studies.notes: The study showed a statistically significant improvement in anxiety levels and health-related quality of life, indicating a benefit from the supplement.

studies.title: The Effects of Combined Scutellaria and Saffron Supplementation on Mood Regulation in Participants with Mild-to-Moderate Depressive Symptoms: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study.

doses.formulation: scutellaria extract, saffron extract, combination of scutellaria and saffron extracts, placebo

studies.notes: The study demonstrated beneficial effects of saffron and scutellaria on mood regulation, with improvements in depressive and anxious symptoms, indicating a positive outcome direction.

indications.summary: Human clinical evidence suggests that saffron may have beneficial effects on anxiety, with two randomized trials reporting improvements in anxiety levels and mood regulation. Doses varied, with one study using 2 tablets daily for 12 weeks and another involving a combination of saffron and scutellaria extracts over six weeks. No adverse effects were reported, but the overall evidence remains limited and further research is needed to confirm these findings.

studies.title: The effects of saffron (Crocus sativus L.) in conjunction with concurrent training on body composition, glycaemic status, and inflammatory markers in obese men with type 2 diabetes mellitus: A randomized double-blind clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in inflammatory markers and metabolic profiles, indicating a benefit from saffron supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized double-blind clinical trial found that saffron supplementation (100 mg daily for 12 weeks) significantly improved inflammatory markers in obese men with type 2 diabetes mellitus, suggesting a potential benefit for chronic inflammation. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: The effect of crocetin (a saffron carotenoid) supplementation on antioxidant and inflammatory indexes and serum leptin concentration in patients with coronary artery disease.
studies.notes: Crocetin supplementation showed significant improvements in some markers but no significant differences in primary outcomes, indicating mixed results.

studies.title: Effects of crocin and saffron aqueous extract on gene expression of SIRT1, AMPK, LOX1, NF-κB, and MCP-1 in patients with coronary artery disease: A randomized placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant beneficial effects on gene expression and serum levels related to CAD.

indications.summary: The evidence regarding saffron for coronary artery disease is mixed. One randomized trial reported beneficial effects on gene expression and serum levels related to CAD with a dose of 30 mg daily for eight weeks, while another study using 10 mg daily of crocetin showed improvements in some markers but no significant differences in primary outcomes. Overall, the findings are not consistent, and further research is needed to clarify the effects.

studies.title: Therapeutic Potential of Saffron Extract in Mild Depression: A Study of Its Role on Anhedonia in Rats and Humans.
studies.notes: The study shows a global improvement in depressive symptoms and a significant reduction in anhedonia, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron in treating mild depression and associated anhedonia.

studies.title: The effect of saffron and corrective exercises on depression and quality of life in women with multiple sclerosis: A randomized controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant benefits in reducing depression and enhancing quality of life in MS patients using saffron and corrective exercises.

studies.title: The effect of Crocus sativus L. (saffron) herbal tea on happiness in postmenopausal women: a randomized controlled trial.

doses.formulation: dried stigmas of saffron boiled in water

studies.notes: The study showed a significant increase in happiness scores in the intervention group, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron tea on mental health.

studies.title: Saffron improves life and sleep quality, glycaemic status, lipid profile and liver function in diabetic patients: A double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomised clinical trial.
studies.notes: Saffron supplementation led to significant improvements in glycaemic status, lipid profile, liver function, sleep quality, and overall quality of life, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Impact of saffron (Crocus Sativus Linn) supplementation and resistance training on markers implicated in depression and happiness levels in untrained young males.

doses.frequency: after each RT session and on non-training days

studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in markers related to depression and happiness levels with saffron supplementation.

studies.title: Crocus Sativus L. (saffron) versus sertraline on symptoms of depression among older people with major depressive disorders-a double-blind, randomized intervention study.
studies.notes: Both saffron and sertraline showed potential to decrease depression symptoms, but no clear advantage was found for either treatment.

studies.title: An Examination into the Effects of a Saffron Extract (Affron) on Mood and General Wellbeing in Adults Experiencing Low Mood: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in depressive symptoms with saffron supplementation, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Co-administration of saffron and chamomile: to determine the efficacy as an adjuvant therapy for mild to moderate depression in human subjects. A pilot randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in depression severity and metabolic alterations in the intervention group, indicating a benefit from the combined use of saffron and chamomile.

indications.summary: The evidence from randomized controlled trials suggests that saffron may have a beneficial effect on depression, with seven studies reporting positive outcomes and one showing mixed results. Typical doses reported range from 1 mg to 150 mg daily, with treatment durations varying from 4 to 12 weeks. No significant adverse effects were noted in the studies reviewed, but the mixed findings in one trial indicate that further research is needed to clarify saffron's efficacy compared to standard treatments.

studies.title: The effect of novel simple saffron syrup on fatigue reduction in patients with multiple sclerosis.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in fatigue severity after saffron syrup consumption.

indications.summary: One randomized trial reported a significant reduction in fatigue severity in patients with multiple sclerosis following the consumption of saffron syrup at a dose of 7.5 cc every 8 hours for two months. Overall, the evidence is limited to a single study, indicating a need for further research to confirm these findings and assess the generalizability to other populations. No adverse effects were reported in the study.

studies.title: Improvement of inflammatory status following saffron (Crocus sativus L.) and resistance training in elderly hypertensive men: A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant reductions in inflammatory markers and cardiovascular risk factors, indicating a benefit from saffron supplementation.

studies.title: Saffron (Crocus sativus L.) in combination with resistance training reduced blood pressure in the elderly hypertensive men: A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in blood pressure with saffron supplementation, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: Two randomized controlled trials have reported benefits of saffron (200 mg daily for 12 weeks) in reducing blood pressure and improving inflammatory markers in elderly hypertensive men. There are no reports of harm or mixed outcomes, suggesting a consistent positive effect; however, further research is needed to confirm these findings across diverse populations.

studies.title: Effect of saffron (Crocus sativus L.) on lipid profile, glycemic indices and antioxidant status among overweight/obese prediabetic individuals: A double-blinded, randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: Saffron supplementation showed improvements in glycemic and antioxidant indices, indicating a benefit for prediabetic individuals.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported that saffron supplementation (15 mg daily for 8 weeks) improved glycemic indices in overweight/obese prediabetic individuals, suggesting a potential benefit. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effects of saffron supplementation on glycemia and inflammation in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus: A randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial study.
studies.notes: Saffron supplementation significantly decreased fasting blood glucose and inflammatory markers, indicating a beneficial effect on T2DM patients.

studies.title: The effect of 12 weeks of aerobic exercise training with or without saffron supplementation on diabetes-specific markers and inflammation in women with type 2 diabetes: A randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in diabetes-related markers, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron supplementation combined with exercise.

indications.summary: Saffron supplementation appears to have beneficial effects on glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes, as evidenced by two randomized controlled trials. Doses of 100 mg and 200 mg daily for 8 to 12 weeks were associated with significant reductions in fasting blood glucose and improvements in diabetes-related markers. However, further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: The anti-dyslipidemia property of saffron petal hydroalcoholicextract in cardiovascular patients: A double-blinded randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated a significant reduction in serum lipid levels in dyslipidemia patients, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported a significant reduction in serum lipid levels among dyslipidemia patients using saffron petal hydroalcoholic extract, suggesting a potential benefit for high LDL cholesterol. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistent dosing guidelines. No adverse effects were reported in the study.

studies.title: The effect of saffron supplement on clinical outcomes and metabolic profiles in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: Saffron supplementation significantly improved various clinical outcomes in rheumatoid arthritis patients, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial reported that saffron supplementation (100 mg daily for 12 weeks) significantly improved clinical outcomes in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating benefit and no reports of harm or mixed results. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and establish consistency.

studies.title: An examination into the mental and physical effects of a saffron extract (affron®) in recreationally-active adults: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study found benefits in males but not in females, indicating mixed outcomes overall.

indications.summary: Current evidence on saffron for enhancing exercise enjoyment is mixed, with one randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study reporting benefits in males but not in females when using a daily dose of 28 mg of a standardized saffron extract (affron®) over six weeks. No consistent positive effects were observed across the population studied, indicating uncertainty regarding its efficacy for this indication.

studies.title: A Randomized, Triple-blind Placebo-controlled Trial to Determine the Effect of Saffron on the Serum Levels of MMP-9 and TIMP-1 in Patients with Multiple Sclerosis.
studies.notes: The study shows significant reduction in MMP-9 and increase in TIMP-1 levels, indicating a beneficial effect of Saffron in MS patients.

indications.summary: One randomized, triple-blind placebo-controlled trial has reported a beneficial effect of saffron on serum levels of MMP-9 and TIMP-1 in patients with multiple sclerosis, suggesting potential therapeutic effects. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety and efficacy.

studies.title: The effect of saffron supplementation on some inflammatory and oxidative markers, leptin, adiponectin, and body composition in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: A double-blind randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant decreases in inflammatory and oxidative markers, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron supplementation.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence from one double-blind randomized clinical trial indicating that saffron supplementation (100 mg daily for 12 weeks) may benefit patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease by reducing inflammatory and oxidative markers. However, due to the small number of studies and the lack of consistency in findings, the overall evidence remains low-quality and mixed.

studies.title: Effects of Saffron Extract on Sleep Quality: A Randomized Double-Blind Controlled Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that saffron extract significantly improves sleep quality and duration, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: An investigation into an evening intake of a saffron extract (affron®) on sleep quality, cortisol, and melatonin concentrations in adults with poor sleep: a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multi-dose study.
studies.notes: Saffron supplementation showed improvements in sleep quality and mood ratings, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Effects of saffron on sleep quality in healthy adults with self-reported poor sleep: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: Saffron was associated with significant improvements in sleep quality measures compared to placebo, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Evaluation of sedative effects of an intranasal dosage form containing saffron, lettuce seeds and sweet violet in primary chronic insomnia: A randomized, double-dummy, double-blind placebo controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvement in insomnia severity and quality of sleep, indicating a beneficial effect of the saffron-containing formulation.

studies.title: A standardised saffron extract improves subjective and objective sleep quality in healthy older adults with sleep complaints: results from the gut-sleep-brain axis randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled pilot study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in both subjective and objective measures of sleep quality, indicating a clear benefit from saffron supplementation.

indications.summary: The evidence from five randomized controlled trials indicates that saffron supplementation is associated with significant improvements in sleep quality among individuals with poor sleep or insomnia. Typical doses reported range from 14 mg to 30 mg of saffron extract per day, with no reported adverse effects or harm. However, the studies vary in formulation and population, which may limit the generalizability of the findings.

studies.title: Effect of vitamin E with and without saffron on the sexual function in women of reproductive age with sexual dysfunction: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant improvement in sexual function and reduction in depression, anxiety, and stress in the experimental group, indicating a benefit from saffron combined with vitamin E.

indications.summary: There is limited evidence suggesting that saffron may improve sexual function in women with sexual dysfunction when combined with vitamin E, as indicated by one randomized controlled trial that reported significant benefits. The study used a dose of 15 mg of saffron daily for 8 weeks. However, further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess the consistency of results across different populations.

studies.title: Acute Effect of a Saffron Extract (Safr'InsideTM) and Its Main Volatile Compound on the Stress Response in Healthy Young Men: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Study.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in stress and anxiety after saffron extract and safranal administration, indicating a beneficial effect on psychological stress response.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover study found that a single dose of 30 mg of saffron extract (Safr'InsideTM) and 0.06 mg of synthetic safranal significantly reduced stress and anxiety in healthy young men. No studies reported mixed or negative outcomes, indicating a potential benefit for stress reduction; however, further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Evaluation of modulatory effects of saffron (Crocus sativus L.) aqueous extract on oxidative stress in ischemic stroke patients: a randomized clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in oxidative stress markers and stroke severity in the saffron group, indicating a beneficial effect.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial reported that saffron (Crocus sativus L.) at a dose of 400 mg twice daily for 4 days resulted in significant improvements in oxidative stress markers and stroke severity in ischemic stroke patients. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Effects of saffron supplementation on oxidative/antioxidant status and severity of disease in ulcerative colitis patients: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in antioxidant status and disease severity, indicating a beneficial effect of saffron supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study reported that saffron supplementation (100 mg daily for 8 weeks) led to significant improvements in antioxidant status and disease severity in patients with ulcerative colitis, suggesting a potential benefit. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: The effect of selenium supplementation on disease activity and immune-inflammatory biomarkers in patients with mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in disease activity and quality of life in the selenium group, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Effects of an Intervention with Selenium and Coenzyme Q10 on Five Selected Age-Related Biomarkers in Elderly Swedes Low in Selenium: Results That Point to an Anti-Ageing Effect-A Sub-Analysis of a Previous Prospective Double-Blind Placebo-Controlled Randomised Clinical Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that selenium supplementation influenced biomarkers in a way that suggests an anti-ageing effect, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: One randomized clinical trial indicates that selenium supplementation (200 µg daily for 48 months) may have an anti-ageing effect by influencing age-related biomarkers in elderly individuals with low selenium levels. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term safety.

studies.title: Selenoprotein P increases upon selenium and coenzyme Q10 supplementation and is associated with telomere length, quality of life and reduced inflammation and mortality.
studies.notes: The study shows that selenium supplementation leads to increased SELENOP levels and is associated with improved health outcomes, indicating a benefit.

indications.summary: Two randomized clinical trials indicate a benefit of selenium supplementation (200 µg daily) for cardiovascular disease, showing improvements in health outcomes and biomarkers associated with aging and inflammation. However, the evidence is limited to these studies, and no adverse effects were reported. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and explore long-term safety.

studies.title: The effect of crocin-selenium nanoparticles on the cognition and oxidative stress markers of multiple sclerosis patients: a randomized triple-blinded placebo-controlled clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in cognitive function and oxidative stress markers, indicating a benefit from the intervention.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported a benefit of selenium, specifically in the form of crocin-selenium nanoparticles, on cognitive function and oxidative stress markers in multiple sclerosis patients, using a dose of 55 mcg for 12 weeks. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study demonstrating positive outcomes and no reports of harm or mixed results.

studies.title: Impact of Nano-Selenium supplementation on the JAK/STAT signaling pathway in major depressive disorder: a Triple-Blind, randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed a greater reduction in gene expression in the nano-selenium group, but the differences were not statistically significant, indicating mixed outcomes.

indications.summary: Current clinical evidence regarding selenium supplementation for depression is limited and mixed. One randomized controlled trial reported unclear outcomes, with no significant differences in gene expression despite a reduction in the nano-selenium group at a dose of 55 µg daily for 12 weeks. Overall, the evidence does not support a clear benefit for selenium in treating depression.

studies.title: The effect of a biweekly novel selenium sulfide-containing topical treatment in symptomatic contact lens wearers: An exploratory study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in symptoms and signs of meibomian gland dysfunction and dry eye syndrome with the selenium sulfide treatment, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Efficacy and safety of AZR-MD-001 selenium sulfide ophthalmic ointment in adults with meibomian gland dysfunction over six months of treatment: A Phase 2, vehicle-controlled, randomized extension trial.
studies.notes: The study showed statistically significant improvements in clinical signs and symptoms of meibomian gland dysfunction, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

studies.title: The Effects of Zinc and Selenium Co-Supplementation on Resting Metabolic Rate, Thyroid Function, Physical Fitness, and Functional Capacity in Overweight and Obese People under a Hypocaloric Diet: A Randomized, Double-Blind, and Placebo-Controlled Trial.

indications.summary: One randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial reported a benefit of selenium supplementation (200 mcg daily for 8 weeks) in increasing resting metabolic rate and physical performance in overweight and obese individuals. However, the overall evidence is limited, with only one study available, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Selenium supplementation in inactive moderate to severe Graves' orbitopathy patients: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The selenium group showed a significant improvement in palpebral aperture, indicating a benefit from supplementation.

indications.summary: One randomized controlled trial reported a benefit of selenium supplementation (200 micrograms daily for 6 months) in patients with inactive moderate to severe Graves' orbitopathy, showing significant improvement in palpebral aperture. However, the evidence is limited to a single study, and further research is needed to confirm these findings and assess long-term effects and safety.

studies.title: Selenium in the treatment of mild-to-moderate Graves' orbitopathy: a 5-year prospective controlled cohort study.
studies.notes: Selenium showed short-term benefits in symptoms and quality of life, but no significant long-term differences were observed.
